Reviews.Title: “Just fine for the money we paid.”
Reviews.Author: Jacalope
Reviews.Content: April 17 - 24, 2012 in room 209 in the Tower. Room was ok overall with some nice touches - much like the photos on the hotel website. Pros: good sized room, nice area to sit with a love seat and coffee table, seperate sink and toilet/tub area. Large safe. Nice desk. Solid wooden furniture. Key for the door always worked - IMHO that is unusual. Water was very hot most of the time, though not as much in the evening (maybe it comes from a distance away). Cons: we are two women and were put on the 2nd floor which can be accessed without a key. It tooks us most of the week to realize this. Would certainly have perferred a secure floor. Our view was of the roof. Sheets were not changed for the week. Tub was old and worn and unstable when you stepped in it. Air conditioning was difficult to regulate - sometimes too hot and sometimes too cold - required lots of adjustment. Having no pool was sad given the high temperature records - but we knew about the lack of a pool when booking. We enjoyed the casino - low table minimums including 25 cent roulette. Good variety of slots. Reasonably quick with comp drinks. We used coupons and ate at the cafe 4 or 5 times (2 for 1). Yes, it is a fairly smoky casino, though we had no problems in our room on the 2nd floor. I would go back but it would depend on price and length of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want to save more to spend on Strip”
Reviews.Author: whaticare
Reviews.Content: Please don't expect any room service for the price of the room, they don't even have bottle opener to borrowed, however the location is prime. 1 min walk to Heart Attack Burger and Fremont Disctrict. The bus to the Strip is right next door, pay $7 a day or $20 for 3 days, it can take you to any stop to the most famous casino on the Strip easily. We saved lots on sleeping but spend more on fancy cocktail in Wynn and Cosmopolitan!

Reviews.Title: “Smoky casino! Go across the street to sleep”
Reviews.Author: mozart8181
Reviews.Content: When you're staying in Vegas, I do recommend the El Cortez, but only if you stay in a Junior Cabana Suite, not in a Tower room. The Cabana Suites are across the street and nicer. I must say, this casino is very, very smoke-filled. The food is a good deal, very good breakfasts and very good prime rib if you don't mind a seedier atmosphere! The only other thing is, beware of being up all night on certain nights even if you're sleeping across the street. Some genius said it was ok for a band to play outdoors all night long (very loudly) on certain nights. On the upside, you're right near Fremont Street, which is a lot of fun. This part of town is the old Vegas without the old glamour, but nevertheless a fun part of town. If you don't have your own car, take the double-decker bus for $7 (for 24 hours) up and down the strip and get on and off whenever and wherever you like, as many times as you want for your 24 hour fare. One last thing, the beds are comfy in the Cabana rooms, but bring your pillow from home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious room”
Reviews.Author: gmon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Thurday and Friday night. I got a great price for the room, $21.00 a night. The room was located in the main tower and was very clean and spacious. Just remember, this is an older hotel so not modern no flat screen tv but it was fine for me. One block to catch the bus for the strip. Two blocks and you are at the start of the Fremont Experience. Three blocks and you can catch the bus to the outlets. A 24 hour bus pass is $7.00. Many good eating place to go near the hotel. Only bad experience I had was my room faced the strip. I thought I might get a little noise from the Fremont Experience but that was a none issue. In fact, first night there ( Thursday ) didn't hear any noise at all. But Friday, a completely different situation. Friday night I went to the Hard Rock to see C.S. and N play. By the time I got back to my room it was past twelve o'clock so I figure I wouldn't have to worry about any noise. Wrong. I guess there's a nightclub nearby and combine the Dj and the music, it was so loud, the windows would vibrate. This lasted until 03:45 in the morning. Glad I had my earplugs with me. They at least helped with the noise. Not sure but maybe this nightclub is only open on Friday and Sat. night? So all in all, I would return to this hotel but next time, ask for a room facing away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdzn5440
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Cortez cause we were looking for a discounted hotel and flight for a good price Downtown.. Anyways. We stayed for 3 nights. Nice rooms,housekeeper always cleaned the room good and changed the sheets. I was really impressed. I was so happy about what a good deal I got! Cocktail servers are good in the casino too. I normally stay on strip. But. Staying downtown is cheaper and you can get on the Bus for 7.00 a day for 24hrs. Save your money and stay downtown!! I also wanted to say they have very friendly staff hotel staff was super friendly, and so was the boss bells man. We had airport shuttle and they were running late he came and checked on us and said we should call. Thanks El Cortez we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: mlr8105
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at the Hotel but did visit the casino for an hour. The customer service was good and the slots paid enough to keep me playing. The beverages were cold unlike a few other places on Fremont. I will definately visit the El Cortez again and get a room there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not for visitors from out of town.”
Reviews.Author: woody1417
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off the main downtown area. We did not stay there, but wanted to check it out, so we walked there and gambled a little. For a downtown casino, the slot and video poker machines did not have the correct pay outs. Hit the Indian casino, they have the same payouts for video poker. There seem to be a tail of 2 cities in the casino. 1 part was very nice and clean, and the other end was dirty and hold. The California casino, and Main street casino and Fitzgerald had better payouts for video poker, but always watch the pay out schedule as some machines pay less for the full house and flush. You have to pick the right machines.

Reviews.Title: “Beware old original rooms in cold weather!”
Reviews.Author: donbvs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an older (original?) room at the El Cortez during a cold snap in Vegas. The heating system apparently served all the rooms in my section and didn't come close to taking the chill off. After the first night during which the cold woke me up a few times, I bought my own space heater and long underwear. That made it somewhat bearable for sleeping, but I cut my visit short and left after the 2nd night. Otherwise, room was sort of okay in every other respect... considering its age and the fact that there was little outside light available which added to the dark, cold experience. I wanted a trip back to "old" Las Vegas... but most probably never again. Although the newer rooms in the tower were fine (per friends on same trip), the overall ambiance of the Cortez was that of a pretty worn out place in my opinion. Sorry to say that as I had hoped for a much better trip down Nostalgia Lane.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Tallulah1958
Reviews.Content: El Cortez was a great place place to stay, location was perfect, walking distance to Fremont just around the corner from downtown Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Got What I Paid For”
Reviews.Author: bucky7680
Reviews.Content: Overall I can’t say I was disappointed with this room because the price was cheap and I did not have high expectations. We stayed in the rooms above the parking structure. This is an older part of the hotel so the rooms are on the small side. There is no desk in the room so I had to use what space there was on the dresser for my lap top. The in room safe is large enough to fit a laptop. My major complaints are with the bathroom; the mechanism for the shower drain was out and lying on the side of the tub. It was impossible to control the temperature of the shower. It when from cold to hot. I had to step out of the way and wait for the water to get in a temperate zone and then jump out again when the temperature changed. I would not recommend staying here if you like to go to sleep before12 am or sleep past 6 am. Even if people are outside speaking in a normal tone you can hear them as if they were in the room but this is Vegas Baby and many of the other guests were drunk and loud. What I did like about this hotel? The staff at the hotel were all nice and pleasant. The price thru Expedia was good. It’s located on Freemont Street which is where I prefer to gamble. We went to the NASCAR race and it was easy to get to Las Vegas Blvd and get to and from the race track. The queen beds were comfortable. Would I stay here again? Yes but I would check the other hotels on Freemont Street first. By the way they did have $3 double deck Blackjack and the slots seemed loose than the rest of Freemont Street. I did walk away with more money than I started with.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: barkinglot
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I just got back from Vegas. I flew at the last minute on Allegiant air and booked a package and stayed at the El Cortez. I chose this hotel because of the price and location and the rooms looked good on the website. I stayed in a tower room and I was really pleased with the room. It was huge with a king size bed, lots of dressers, a sitting area with coffee table and love seat and a huge window overlooking north Vegas. There was a coffee maker in the room which was a nice touch. Stayed at Harrahs last time and although the room was nice, there was no coffee maker and it cost $5+ to get a coffee in the lobby at Starbucks. The hotel is old and if you're coming to gamble, they advertise that their slots are 30% looser. I liked the location at the east end of Freemont St. It's only a few steps to the lively nightlife under the canopy. The food was fantastic in the coffee shop. I didn't eat in the dining room but other guests told me it was really good. There's free parking attached to the hotel which was great because I rented a Piaggio Scooter (400ccs). I toured around Vegas and left the city for the short ride to Red Rock Canyon. It was a beautiful ride and a must see for anyone who visits the area. Super scenery. Next time I plan to go to the Hoover Dam or the Valley of Fire. Las Vegas area is made for bikers. Good highways and I found it easy to get around. Even had fun driving down the strip on Las Vegas Blvd. As part of my stay, I was offered an entry into their free slot tournament and I placed third and won $100! Canadians be warned, they took 30% off the top because I didn't have a foreign tax number. If you ever won a jackpot and had to apply for a tax rebate, bring along your tax number and they will give you the full winnings. One day I walked south to the Strip and although I'm a very slow walker it only took me about 2 hours and it was interesting. You could easily do it in just over an hour if you are a "normal" speed walker. I would definitely stay at the El Cortez again and I would reccommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay At The El Cortez!”
Reviews.Author: persians2
Reviews.Content: Another trip to the El Cortez! Was hoping it would be as great as the last time (in September 2011), and we were NOT disappointed. This time we arrived early on Valentines Day and stayed a week. We got the same tower room we had last time, on the top floor, with a fabulous view of the strip and the mountains. We had a very romantic Valentines dinner at The Flame in the Cortez. A wonderful place. Low lighting, piano music, live, the whole time during dinner. A lovely rose for the ladies. Wonderful food. We spent 3 hours on this wonderful meal, killing a large bottle of wine in the process.Wonderful, vintage old Vegas! Full, and mellow we turned in early. I highly recommend the tower rooms. They are large with a super comfy sitting area with a great view. We have stayed in just about every hotel and resort in Vegas, on the strip and downtown, and we love the Cortez the best. Prices are right, the gambling is fabulous (especially the blackjack) and the comps seem to come easily. We ate almost free the whole time we were there. In addition to The Flame, they have the Cafe, and it has just as fabulous food as the Flame. I highly recommend the Cortez. One of the few hotels in Vegas with a FREE town car drive to the airport, and coffee pots in the room! One of my pet peeves in Vegas is no coffe pots in the rooms in 95% of the hotels. Have to either way overpriced room service coffee, which arrives cold, or get dressed and go in search of $4 a cup coffee. Not at The El Cortez. You can get up in the AM and enjoy hot coffee in great sitting area. One other little thing I want to throw in...be sure and eat the buffet at Main Street Station. It is voted in the top 5 in Vegas, and the food, ambiance and service are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Escape
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed at this property and once again I found this to be a very acceptable property for the price and location. This is also the second time that we stayed in the Cabana rooms across the street. Now while I will agree that the colors are a bit funky, I don't find them so disturbing that I would not stay again. And since this building is "across the street" from the main building, I appreciate the fact they have a security guard and restricted key access to the building. Why do some people say that is "shady" or a "sketchy part of town"??? We have walked back to our room at all hours of the night both through the main El Cortez building and via the side streets around it and have not ever had a problem or even felt like we would but to each his own. For the rates that you can get for staying here we feel that it is well worth it. The hotel itself and casino is not part of the Fremont Experience and is just a couple of blocks outside if the main area. For ourselves, we like winding down with a quick walk back to the hotel after being in the main Fremont area. The room we had again was in the Cabana building across the street and it was clean and comfortable and was a good value for the price paid. We asked for an extra pillow and got it promptly even though it was late at night. On the days that we wanted housekeeping service they came in and did a great job. Both check-in and check-out was easy, friendly and helpful. We feel the casino here is great. We often use play here at the beginning and end of our days and love the fact that they have great low minimum tables and some really great friendly dealers. We also eat at both the Cafe and the Flame restaurants and find the Cafe to be one of the best values almost anywhere in Vegas. We could get a full plate for breakfast for less than an egg sandwich at Dunkin Donuts. If you are traveling to downtown Vegas and just a good room for a good price and an overall good place, you should try El Cortez. We will be back again, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: yuckyfaghag1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days/3 nights in February 2012 for a concert in Las Vegas. Our rooms were very clean and up to date, the only flaw was the bathrooms, the tub was outdated and the heat lamp didn't work right. There also wasn't an iron. Overall the room was very clean and up to date, and the room service was very nice. They were friendly and brought us extra towels when requested. The room smelled fresh and the beds were comfortable. The casino of the hotel was a typical Vegas casino, fairly large and well kept. The valet service was always friendly and on good time. The hotel is located in the main downtown area, the walk to Fremont street was about 5 minutes. We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning, the food was very good and the portions were large as well, and fair for its price. Overall this was a good stay and fair for its price! Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Cabana Suites - You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl181747
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in downtown Las Vegas. It is NOT part of the Fremont experience. As a matter a fact, it is a couple of main streets beyond it. The area is a bit shady - so much so that there is a security guard permanently stationed at the entrance to the Cabana Suites. The rooms are decent and kept clean but they are a horrible green color - can't quite figure out that choice. The staff in the hotel and the casino are extremely friendly and the casino itself has a fairly good atmosphere with low minimums at the tables. I will return to play at the El Cortez (in the daylight) but I don't intend to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice casino, rude staff in Sports book”
Reviews.Author: fuggataboutit
Reviews.Content: Had three nights at the ElCo - it was at no charge because I was in town for a funeral. Made some bets at the sports book and this guy named Chet or Chad behind the counter acting like he was doing me a favor. I said should I use el cortez club card and he said nah that I don't bet enough. And then he made me repeat my bets a couple of times and he kept looking away like he rather be elsewhere. I had a few beers so I didn't think much of it. Went back the next day and the guy there Steve, new guy, treated me much better. But whenever Chet was there I avoided the book and took my business elsewhere. Room was fine. Freemont street was always interesting but kinda sketchy in some parts. I've done the strip and it is not worth the hassle. Will I recommend downtown Vegas compared to the Strip-Yes. Will I recommend El Cortez - nope.

Reviews.Title: “Coping badly in the Cabana suites..”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller84
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here once before in November 2007 and returned in February 2012. Friendly service at the reception desk. Seemed to be given the option of whether to stay in the older bit or the new Cabana suite and happily went for the latter as it's newer. The building was new and modern (with a useful iPhone/iPod bedside recharger) although the light for the bathroom is inbuilt into the wall at a surprisingly low level so I couldn't find it at first! The bedroom was fairly small and painted a slightly ugly green colour which was odd I felt given the newness of the building. White is cleaner and better, guys! The bed was comfortable but, dear me, the noise from a nearby nightclub kept me awake on or off until about 4.30am (I was awake for the last song). Not just distant noise, but window tubthumping. So if you're given a choice at reception - choose NOT to go for the Cabana suite!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Fun at El Cortez”
Reviews.Author: kkirwan
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for a quick family trip (only 2 nights) due to location and price (under $50 for 2 nights!). We love Downtown and the prices are so much better here for just about everything. We originally booked the Cabana Suites because the rooms looked really cute. Once we parked and saw the somehwhat "sketchy" area, we asked for rooms in the Tower instead. This was no problem and we got 4 (out of the 5 we needed) of our rooms together on the 9th floor. All were large, clean and had a far off Strip view! There was a cute little loveseat with a coffee table, a nice desk, a huge dresser and adorable iron-work lamps. I think the decor was maybe a "Cuban" theme. Beds were simple, nice linens, lots of pillows and very comfy. Old TV. Coffee maker! My only complaint would be the pretty small bathroom and closet off to the side. Shower was good with lots of pressure and hot water. Ok toiletries. Safe did not work. Casino here is small but with lower gaming tables. Spent hours at the $1 roulette table! Awesome amazing steakhouse here too, called the Flame. A must try! Would stay here again but not in summer as they don't have a pool. Close to everything on Fremont Street too! A great stay at a charming, Old School Vegas hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Nice Casino”
Reviews.Author: Diana7Michigan
Reviews.Content: Our first stay off strip. We spend so much time gambleing and partying on Freemont thatwe wanted to stay there. Picked El Cortez because of price. Read all the reviews beforehand. Wanted to see for myself. Valet parking nice friendly clean area. First impression when I walked into Casino nice decor clean maybe a little Too much pumped in scent. Was not smokey. Check in was nice the guy was friendly it was after midnight. We did upgrade our room To a strip view in tower. Elevator was quick and clean secure have to use room key which is differant but safe. Short walk to rooms. Clean hallways and nice decor. Room clean great lighting options. Clean beds I checked for critters everything Was clean. Nice decor reminded me of staying at a bed n breakfast. Love seat and coffee table over looking a nice view. Grest place to was people and distant mountains. Bathroom was small sink area nice separate from toilet and bath. Bath area was nice like my old house homey. Shower head felt like rain very relaxing. Cool little window that opens inside tub area. First room I have ever had that had 3 waste baskets love not haveing to walk to find one. Room had no iron but did have a blow dryer. Walk to Freemont was iffy just stay in a group or come back to El Cortez before 11pm. It is a 2 block walk before next casino.

Reviews.Title: “Much better then I expected”
Reviews.Author: Visalia11
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in the towers at the El Cortez for two nights over the Christmas holiday. We picked the hotel for its very low price (ave about $25 per night), decent reviews and location. The room is a standard motel room with a decent bed and couch. The furniture is older real dark wood that added a nice feel to the room. The TV was not a flat screen but that was OK. It was nothing fancy but I'd certainly say it was average. I've stayed in much worse for way more money. Staff treated me fine. We did not do much at the hotel, just placed a few football bets, had a few drinks and a light meal. The casino looked ok and I planned to play Roulette do to low min bet but did not get to it. The location is at the end of Fremont street and is handy to visit other down town hotels etc. I had not been down there in years and it is much different the the strip (Seedier I suppose), but we had fun were able to walk to many casino's which was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Retro Vegas - rooms are pretty decent and much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeDuder
Reviews.Content: eventhough my booking was missing when I checked in- the assistant manager soon made good the error. And even when we had to tolerate the first night without power from 1am- 6am ( cold night that was) . Reason being that they were switching power systions or something. I still think el Cortez is a gem of a find. My 5 night stay was very comfortable n pleasant. Food n staff at the cafe is excellent n I'll definitely come back again when Im back in town

Reviews.Title: “Cant escape the smell of stale cigarettes :(”
Reviews.Author: novisfamily
Reviews.Content: the room we booked was "pavillion" - steer well clear as they look like run down motel rooms and very unsafe environment. we made our minds up when stepping out of the lift realising how run down they looked. we opened the door just in case they were nicer inside - but alas they were worse. We went straight down to reception and had to pay $10 per night extra for an upgraded room in the tower. Although they were better, the picutres on the website are nothing like the real thing and must have been taken decades ago. The worst thing about this hotel is that you cannot get to the lift without going onto the casino floor and then being gassed by the stench of stale smoke. your clothes stink by the time you have left the casino from the lift. I would never ever recommend this hotel dispite the pictures it is definitely not a nice place. There are better hotels for the same price. The staff were all very unhelpful and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, great fun, great winnings”
Reviews.Author: JRinLasVegas
Reviews.Content: The home of "Bugsy" Siegel, Mafioso gangster was a delight. We played slot machines near the piano bar - what a treat! The skilled pianist kept the tunes rolling and I settled down into the old Las Vegas vibe with a smile. People were friendly, approachable, the staff was right there when we had questions. We will frequent this Las Vegas treasure often - and I doubled my $$ at the slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place to play blackjack and roulette”
Reviews.Author: Ottawawomanlaura
Reviews.Content: First, I will start by saying that I did not stay in this hotel but did spend lots of my time gambling in this casino. Positives: 3 dollar blackjack tables .25 roulette mostly good drink service (of course tipping helps get good service) the clientele are generally unpretentious people that want to have fun (unlike the strip) couple nice blackjack dealers (David) Negative points: very, very, very smokey most of their dealers barely speak English sometimes in the later evening or shift change, it can take a long time to get a drink Overall, it's a great "low roller" casino. Most of the time, good drink service as well. For $20, you can sit at the roulette table for a couple hours and drink free. A good spot for the budget oriented Vegas traveller that likes to gamble and have a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Not as the locals had promised”
Reviews.Author: EdnaRae
Reviews.Content: We were excited to check out the newly remodeled El Cortez while in town on business. We were told by some locals that the owner had done an amazing job restoring the place. Yikes! there are some things that shouldn't be restored then. This is one of those smoky entrances with slots in your face and the bellman was avidly biting his nails when I checked in at the front desk. Upon arrival to my room it appeared they'd forgotten to put a bedspread. Without it on, I was able to see the mattress was severely deformed. I requested to be transferred to another room. Same lack of bedspread but at least the mattress appeared flat. This place is poorly done and I would not advise staying here. Check out the Golden Nugget instead. Rates are about the same and MUCH nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Less Pomp and Gouge, More Substance and Comp”
Reviews.Author: musicmaster
Reviews.Content: Our days of hiking all over the increasingly pricey strip - where you're hardpressed to get a comped beer in the Epcot-like mirage (sic) - ended several years back when we switched to cheaper, friendlier and, I think, more fun, Fremont Street locations. While the Golden Nugget is the downtown jewel with its Old Vegas Rat Pack glitz and polish (and many great beers on the house, even for slot players), the El Cortez is now homebase for us - they have the best comps/rates, loosest machines, and a hard-to-describe but ultracool time-warping ambience of old Vegas gangster hangout, rehab-over-replace, seasoned friendly staff, and great inexpensive food in their 24-hour restaurant (featuring Chinese entrees in the evenings). In a city where great deals are harder to come by, you can find a slew of them at the fun, lively El Cortez. It's just block away from the Fremont Street experience and the bus to the strip if you need a break from gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Flame Steak House”
Reviews.Author: JimMcD
Reviews.Content: The Flame located inside the El Cortez is a great value for a good steak dinner. For about $100 including tip you can get two Filet Mignons, an appetizer, two sides, bread and a bottle of wine. Ok this place isn't Mortons Steak House but neither is the price. Atmosphere is Old School Vegas in an Old School Vegas Casino. Our waiter was accomodating without being bothersome. Food was prepared as we liked it and the portions were good. Use the coupon that is avaiable and save $25.

Reviews.Title: “o.k it is not a four star hotel more like two star but for the price and the adventure it can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: Robone13
Reviews.Content: The El Cortez is long past it's prime but gives you a great value for the price and is not right on Fremont Street, which is a bonus (less noise and street hustlers). Fremont St. is not the place to stay for everyone but if you like to chase your luck by casino hopping and aren't willing to take a 20 minute stroll to get to the next casino like on the strip then Fremont may be for you. Plus the rooms are for the most part similar in quiality to those on the strip, but at a reduced rate if you book from an online discount website. A word of warning though be careful walking the 2 blocks back to the El Cortez from Fremont St. at 5 a.m. after gambling all night, the area is full of street hustlers and you gotta watch your back as there is no else around at this time (police, other "innocent" by-standards) or you might get rolled for your bank roll. a paltry $500 in my case but still hard earned money. Keep your head up, your best don't mess with me scowl on your face, avoid eye contact, walk fast and of course do not stop to conversate. Nothing good can come of a conversation in this situation. there is no upside for you. or just leave earlier. Back to the El Cortez. The room was large and clean. the bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. The bath area was dated but also clean with no obvious stains. And a bonus, there was no disgusting comforter to ball up and throw in the corner, cause god knows they never wash those things. We paid 30/ nite from a booking website. great deal and lots of adventure Dowtown Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in downtown”
Reviews.Author: shaochew
Reviews.Content: We got the "deluxe room" at the pavilion, which is on the top (5th) floor of a parking garage. Room is average quality, clean and comfy, no issues. For the price we pay, this is definitely a gem in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vegas hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: boslera
Reviews.Content: My stay started with the computer system being down and the hotel being unable to give me a room. Since I had to change my clothes and freshen up for a work-related mixer, I had to drag my suitcase into the Ladies Room of the Casino and change in a bathroom stall, putting on my makeup under the fluorescent lights. When I finally got to my Pavilion Room that evening, it was tiny and extremely cold. The outside temperature was in the 30's. I don't know what the temperature in the room was, because the lowest the thermostat goes is 60, and the needle was lower than that. After an hour or so of having the heater on, the temperature in the room got up to about 64 degrees, and even with the heater on all night, it never got above 70 in my room. My feet were extremely cold from the tile in the bathroom/sink area, and there were no extra blankets to be found, so I had to take the very thin blanket off the other bed in my room and put it on the bed I was sleeping on, but I still felt cold all night. I went there with a coworker, and our first impression was that it was smoky and noisy, not only in the casino, but in our non-smoking rooms. The rooms across from us were smoking rooms, and there were ashtrays only a couple of feet from our doors, so smoke still gets into the rooms when you open the doors. The clock in my room wasn't plugged in, and the outlet was behind the headboard, so I couldn't reach it. The water in the shower vacillates between hot and cold, doesn't stay one temperature. But the icing was when the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night--not once, but twice! I've stayed downtown before, and never felt like I was at a motel 6, until I stayed at the El Cortez. It seemed run-down and sketchy. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, ammenities, and price!”
Reviews.Author: Ebabelover
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel and casino. The location is on Fremont and free parking so I never had to drive. I was surprised at how spacious the room was with a queen size bed, 2 closets, a sectional type couch, desk area, coffee maker, hair dryer, complimentary shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and soap.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Vegas for the 2010s”
Reviews.Author: worldismylobster
Reviews.Content: Travelled solo. Booked a Vintage room for 2 separate stays of 2 and 3 nights. 1st booking was upgraded to suite. On first entering there is a strong smell of smoke (although rooms allegedly non-smoking). However, soon clears with AC full on. Plenty space in living area (L shaped couch), separate desk area, good storage although bathroom quite small. Casino now well laid out with room to move. Cafe much improved from 2005 visit (good food selection - non-greasy). Reception staff especially very friendly and room well cleaned daily. Dealers helpful and relaxed. Near Fremont St experience. Try Heart Attack grill (quadruple bypass burgers, flatliner fries, triple vodka shots with cream,etc. Eat free if over 350 lbs. Waitresses dressed in skimpy nurses ER attire). 2nd stay vintage room smaller but still OK. Complimentary limo to airport on departure a plus. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “i love this place”
Reviews.Author: ekim0517
Reviews.Content: i have been to there approx 8 times i have stayed at many hotels i have stayed in the tower the old part and they cabana suites and i have to say i really enjoyed the cabana suites and the tower was nice but i didnt care for the older rooms as they are really run down as for the rest of the hotel there is alot of people that know me and my wife by first name (that might mean we go to much) the casino section has many slots but not alot of card tables which is kind of a down fall seen as all i play is black jack and roulette but its nice because it never really gets to busy which i like even better. i also like that it is only two blocks away from the Freemont experience because it has a tendency to get loud over in that area. i also enjoy that my wife always feels safe there with there security that will escort her if i am not with her no matter where she may need to go on the property. i really enjoy it there it has an older feel and brings in the older crew but im ok with that because when i come in to go to bed i want quiet (and old people go to bed early) (no offense to elder people) i would recommend the EL Cortez to any one you definitely get more then you pay for beside the only time any one is in there room in Vegas is to sleep. food is average bar is great servers and other staff are AAAAAAmazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to play”
Reviews.Author: CKYoung
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Vintage room Nov 4-7. Front desk people were very friendly but was a bit leary about the guests checking in at the same time. The room was poor. The walls were extremely thin especially to outside noise. The bed was a bit thread bare to the point that we didn't realize there was a blanket on it under the sheets until the second day. The bathroom was cramped with very little water pressure. No flat screen TV. Overall the room was clean but not comfortable. The lobby, Cafe, and casino though were very nice. Food at the Cafe was always very good and plentiful. The casino was nice, never crowded, with a lot of locals to talk to. A true diamond in the rough. Access to Fremont area was easy and safe. Great cigar shop in route for those who stogie. Bus access to Strip close and cheap $7 24 hrs. My highest recommendation on the Strip is the new Margarittaville Cafe and Casino in the Flamingo. Great food, Great atmosphere, Newest casino on the strip (opened 10-01-11), and the friendliest blackjack dealers ever. Overall a good trip. Might try the Cabana next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cabana Suites are Great!”
Reviews.Author: edog1308
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the El Cortez Cabana Suites for a couple of nights after staying for the Halloween weekend on Fremont Street. We had always heard good things about the El Cortez and decided that we wanted to check it out for ourselves. After three nights in a smaller bed, we decided that we wanted to get a King Size bed which was available in their Cabana Suites which is located across Ogden Street from the original El Cortez property. Check in was a breeze. Parking for the Cabana Suites is a little confusing. There is a huge parking lot next door to the hotel and I assumed that is where I would park the car. I guess that is for Valet since I could not park there. El Cortez actually has two parking garages, one on the property itself and one across from the Cabana Suites. I parked in the farther garage the first day and then parked in the regular garage after that. The room itself was great. Large and very colorful. Green paint throughout but done very tastefully. A very comfortable bed and a large plasma TV on the wall. The bathroom was laid out a little strange with the toilet being around the corner as you walk in, but the shower was a walk in with a shower-head that was high enough for me and I am 6'3". Since the Cabana Suites are across from the main property, there was always a security guard on duty making sure only guests were accessing the hotel. I always felt safe walking from the El Cortez to the Fremont Street Experience. We even walked down Ogden all the way from Main Street Station at 3am and I never felt insecure at all. The Fremont Street area is great and the El Cortez is a great place to stay and get a little bit different of a Downtown Vegas feel. I look forward to going back next year and hopefully spending a couple of nights back at the El Cortez. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: voixcassee
Reviews.Content: We slept in a vintage room. The view is the parking. It is not quiet because a shop in the street plays music 24h/24. It smells smoke even if it is a non smoking room. Furniture is old. But it is clean. We paid 30$ per night and it was a friday and a saturday. So it was perfect for the price. The only thing that we complain is the "non-smoking" thing. They should tell that is a smoking room

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: AlejandroNorte
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay, moved out after 2 days and left the prepaid room empty because this place is a S-hole. The hotel cannot control the lousy neighborhood, winos, and addicts that form a gauntlet on the way in and out, but the can control the customer experience once you enter the building. Room was NOT ready on time. Room was absolutley FILTHY; Did not expect much based on price and reviews but this was below one star. Mold and mildew all over the bathroom, the room stank, the beds and floors were dirty. I have never seen a property maintained with such indifference. Everything was worn out and disgusting; an appointment with a wrecking ball is 20 years overdue. Front desk would not offer an alternate room (we even offered to PAY for an upgrade!) Website photos and descriptions are hugely misleading; had to have been shot decades ago or extensively retouched! If you are looking for budget accomodations, look somewhere else; there are plenty of inexpensive options in Las Vegas that are nowhere near this bad!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Casino and Lounge”
Reviews.Author: bdagley
Reviews.Content: First, we did not stay at the El Cortez so this review is not about the accomodations. We wandered in off the street to check out the casino and lounge and we are glad we did. The slots were lose, the drinks were generous and the entertainment was good. In short for a good time on Fremont this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad spot”
Reviews.Author: corleone11
Reviews.Content: i like playing downtown, $3 craps in the day time at el cortez and a decent sports/race book area

Reviews.Title: “Just stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Darlene H
Reviews.Content: I have fairly low expectations for hotel rooms in Las Vegas. We basically shower and sleep there, so our needs are easy to meet. When we tried to check into our rooms on a Thursday afternoon, one room was not ready. We were given a few different times the room was going to be ready, and after a couple hours, it finally was. The room I stayed in was the worst of the bunch. It was in the section called the "vintage rooms" and there is a reason for that! The list of complaints is long, so bear with me. The room was small, with no desk, fridge, or microwave. The old wood window rattled randomly, so we wedged some toilet paper in it to minimize that vibration noise. The switch on the entrance wall controlled the TV, not a light. The HVAC is noisy, and the exhaust fan are loud enough to have to really raise your voice over. The sink and tub did not drain well, took 15-20 minutes to drain the sink after brushing your teeth. The room had a pedestal sink, a tiny shelf, the back of the toilet and lid to put your toiletries, no vanity top, so you could have a comb, soap and toothbrush/toothpase out, that was about it. The toilet seat had to be held up to use it. The hotel towels are not bath sized, I would call them salon towels, unless you are wrapping one around a small child, it is not an adequate towel. One morning, I was observing how I felt the room had not been cleaned the day before, so I left one lonely piece of toilet paper in the bowl, closed the lid and left. When we came back to the room in the evening, the piece of tp was still there. We went to go back to our room the last night and our room key would not work. It took way too much to convince the front desk person we were booked through that night. It took so long, I had to have a bathroom break. But when I came back, she found the mistake, decided we were ok to stay and renewed our key. The reason I give this hotel two stars despite all the issues: the beds are comfy, the showers are hot and most of the staff are friendly. I really liked the price and it is not far from the Fremont St. Experience. But I doubt I would stay here again. And I would suggest you stay somewhere else too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Amber D
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel for the price we paid. We arrived Saturday morning around 11 am, we were not able to check in early, that was a little disappointing, but we survived. We had a tower room and it was decent. The beds were pretty comfortable, I did not wake up with a back ache every morning. Lots of people said the bathroom was small, but I didnt' find it that bad at all. We had a nice view of the strip. The air conditioning kept us cool(other people had reported that the air was not cool enough). I loved the older style furniture, very classy. The bar had very good drinks and friendly staff. Check out happy hour, $4 martinis, You can't beat that with a bat!! The staff was older and a little slower, but nothing too awful. The cocktail waitresses did not come around as often as I would have liked while gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage King Suite - Cool & Cheap”
Reviews.Author: FamilyDad22
Reviews.Content: We like the old school vibe of Vegas. Being able to walk to another casino or bar. Downtown is great and the El Cortez is 2 blocks from everything. The vintage King suites are terrific and large. The casino is cool and the people here are friendly. We had a problme with the safe in our room. It took a while to get fixed, but everything else is good. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping services left something to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: spits123
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I recently returned from a 5 night stay at the El Cortez Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas. A birthday present for him. We were going for the car race and thought it would be closer to access a shuttle to the track and I have read positive things on TA about the gaming so thought we would give it a try. I chose a junior cabana suite thinking it would be worth paying a little extra. The decor was modern and funky. Fun to hang out in the room although a little small for a suite. I agree with others on here that the slots appear to be looser than other hotels we have stayed at in recent years and the blackjack pays 3:2 but in our experience quite hard to beat the dealer/house. Most staff in the casino were pleasant but others appeared to be tired and uninterested in their job or the customers in front of them. We found the staff in the Cortez cafe and Flame restaurant were great. It was the hostess in the Flame restaurant that retrieved the information for the shuttle to the race track when we asked at dinner although the bellman and front desk staff had been unable to do so earlier in the day. All staff were very friendly on our visits to both restaurants. The food was exceptional in the Flame restaurant. I would say the lamb chops are a must try as is the scampi and linguini. Meals in the cafe were great and excellent prices and you can use your comp. dollars in both restaurants. There is a walkway from the El Cortez to Freemont that has been refurbished which made it much less scary than I expected. I must admit this was one of my main concerns about staying there was the walk to Freemont at night as it seems a bit out of the way. Looked like a road a less traveled and not so well lit. I am not normally a fussy person or one to complain but this time I felt strongly about the poor housekeeping service and this place being advertised as the only "boutique hotel" in the Freemont district. The first morning, inspite of the Do Not Disturb sign posted on the door the maid was trying to enter the door to our room as I was walking out of the bathroom which she apologized for as she looked down at the sign. Thank goodness I was dressed. I assured her we would be leaving soon. Two days later the maid was knocking loudly on the door at 0930 hrs, again I informed her we would soon be leaving soon. I thought Vegas was about staying up late & sleeping in but not here I guess. It appeared the bathroom? or the toilet was being cleaned, we doubt the shower was cleaned, but the water was left running in the toilet on two of the five days. We arrived back about supper time and could only assume it had been running for several hours as it was obvious that the maid arrives fairly early in the morning. So much for water conservation in the desert. Second to our last day we returned that to a poorly made bed, dirty glasses and a dirty coffee cup left on the counter. We wanted to relax and have a drink in our room before heading out and thought a clean glass might be in order, I called down to the front desk who put me through to housekeeping and they said they would send someone up with clean glasses. This person did not arrive so when my husband went out for his cigarette he complained to the woman at the front desk about our disappointment in the poor service and within about 10 minutes the maid was at the door with glasses. By that time he had washed them in the bathroom sink and turned her away in frustration. Too little too late. Boutique hotel maybe but not the service one would expect, Next time I will pay less and return to one of the hotels I have stayed at in the past that have provided much better service for less money. I might return to the El Cortez for dinner and a little slot play but I would not stay there again. There is way too much competition in Vegas these days to not expect decent housekeeping service and clean glasses in your room. By the way very friendly security staff outside the cabana suites building 24/7 which we appreciated as you have to walk outside and cross the street to this building. Overall had a great time in Vegas as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the budget-minded”
Reviews.Author: JoelsKitty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the El Cortez for 6 nights. We had the "vintage room". The price was right. The vintage rooms are small (especially the bathroom) but our room was clean and the bed comfortable. The temps were in the 90's while we were there and I found it difficult to keep the room cool. The smoke from the casino is obvious in the hallways but I didn't notice it after I got in the room. All-in-all, we were satisfied. As for the casino, the drink service was slow and/or non-existent at times. The El Cortez Cafe has great, cheaply priced food with excellent service. We would probably stay here again, for the price, but would choose a tower room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: spanky132
Reviews.Content: The location, a bit scetchy. The casino, smells like old lady perfume. We stayed in the newish Cabana Suites and loved them. Very cool rooms at an unbeatable price. If you are staying downtown give the Tez a try.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest hotel deal in my life”
Reviews.Author: Maurice C
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on hotelshed.com in August 2019 for £3:20 per room !! August rates can be so cheap because not many people like the 110 degree heat and rooms are lying empty. We got a rooftop room which required you to swipe a credit card pass to get the elevator to the top. Also had a free breakfast, $5 gambling cards and two free drinks so it don't get much better than that. I kept my credit card booking receipts as nobody believes the costs. Regardless of the costs, the hotel offers excellent facilities, good location close to the Freemont Street Experience and nice clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “the best food”
Reviews.Author: scarden10
Reviews.Content: We stay in the hotel a lot we love it good food ,best customer services

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL AT A GREAT PRICE”
Reviews.Author: desertfolks22
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great, rooms clean bedding fine furniture good. We were on the 11th floor quiet. Other reviewers spoke of coffee pots in room. There was no coffee pot, there is a machine that makes one cup of coffee, if you have a cup, there to are 2 single serve packet one decaf one regular, housekeeping was nice did offer extra coffee and a usa today. Instead we walked to 7/11, we had a tea drinker and got our coffee there, what a selection of coffee and all the extras! The bartenders were the worst, we were they during bikefest. One bartender I asked about it said he never heard of it, wanted to know when it starts, "Well it starts today thru Sunday sponsored by Fremont St". Hello, the hotel is on Fremont St, then he said I m not interested in that. The hotel was full for biker folk! next bartender was worse did me a favor giving me a drink when I gave the coupon, which i got from the hotel, acted I was some kind of low life. Not much different with check in check out, No welcome, hello, or smile. "How can I help you" Well I am in a check in line I have lugguge and tired. What do you think? Given keys "the elevator is overthere"( no where close to the parking lot elevator) there is a trick to get to ur room figure it out urself or ask another guest. Check out same No thank you, come back, how was ur stay, Sorry about the alarm going off 2am for no reason. No real eye contact , "just ur all set". The Club area to get your coupon book one gal was too busy texting to help so the other sad sack helped. The Cafe Cortez was excellent and friendly waitress. Its a couple of blocks to the Fremont Experience, area is lower end but safe alot security around and police. Staff doent seem to know without US they wont have a job. The gaming table were slow so the dealers stood around talking and laughing (asian speaking). So overall had a great time and a rock bottom price for 3 nights including a Friday nite stay for around 95 bucks including tax. May go back if the price is right. Management staff?. What management staff...

Reviews.Title: “"Serving Downtown Since Bugsy Owned The Joint"”
Reviews.Author: SouthernOhioNaillady
Reviews.Content: That's their slogan and you can tell. I mean that in a good way. They are celebrating their 70th anniversary this year and if you like nostalgia you'll love this place. Was pleasantly surprised by my room - wasn't expecting much but the room was large and comfortable. Furniture was old (dark wood) even a drop top desk! Loveseat and coffee table, window in bathroom. I love old, but clean, comfy rooms and this one was. Staff is young and friendly, except for the the guys at the bell desk. These guys were great!but looked as if they had worked there since Bugsy......!! Really nice gents, had that old time polite, helpful demeanor. Casino is small but fun. Restaurants, food, very good. Excellent Chocolate Martini! We booked a package here because with airfare it was cheaper than airfare alone. But if you took advantage of their summer promotion the room would have been free. ($25/night with $25 food credit). We like downtown and for the money this place was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “True Original”
Reviews.Author: Roswellcop
Reviews.Content: The original Vegas Hotel. I recommend everyone stay downtown. If you want to hear the sound of real money coming out of the slots and play on cheaper tables this is the place. Remodelled rooms. Great restaurant with great prices and service. Great time

Reviews.Title: “Average facility but good value”
Reviews.Author: Tommy72A
Reviews.Content: Old Vegas on Budget.. that sum's up the review. nothing fancy like the strip but if you are serious about gambling and earing your comp dollar, you may want to check this place out. This place is filled with middle age and up, value oriented middle class folks and occasional young folks lured by cheap rate. We stayed in the Cabana suite, decored with lime green, silver and black. I guess they are aiming for some kind of botique hotel status. Bathroom is huge and everything else seems to be up to par. It's not exactly my taste but it's something different. Don't worry about the security, it's all good. If blackjack is your game, plenty of tables with $5 min bet. If you are staying in downtown for hardcore gambling and never ending comp drinks, this is your joint. Yep.. you can be a high roller, in a low ball casino. If this is your first visit to Vegas, go to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Old Las Vegas on a budget”
Reviews.Author: cincytravelerOhio
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have stayed at the El Cortez several times. The low minimums on the tables and the low hotel prices give us a lot of extra money to gamble. The rooms are quite nice for the money. If you goto Vegas for the old style gambling experience and don't expect the Ritz, you will enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “We Love this place...”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: The El Cortez - is our 'go to' hotel. Sure we stay at different places just to check things out and see what's happening around town when we visit - but the El Cortez remains our no-frills, no overpayment, meat and potatoes hotel/casino. Its small, its pretty simple - and it works. Everything is clean, the dealers are fun when you have a chance to talk with them and enjoy yourself! The diner is what you'd expect - no frills - and it works perfectly fine...!

Reviews.Title: “old and dark rooms at low prices”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: not really a nice place,nor an evil place...just o;d. thus cheap (35 us) so nothing to complain especially. if you stay in the tower which is newer it might be kind of brighter.the windows opened to an interior ward (yes...jail atmosphere) ,but noisy from the outside beggars and roomstaff carts that had to be moved permamently in front of the cells...oops rooms :) noisy!!! and awful nordic smoking and screaming tourist in the hallways :) and bums on the street. better avoid this paty of vegas.fremont street is kind of run down and very thirdworld like. i changed the hotel and went to palace station later. this one is okay for 35 bucks but try to avoid it. ahhh....rooms are clean and have coffe e maker, room service is efficient and staff is friendly....but tn total between poor and average....avoid it:)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: ABQLyon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a block from the "old" strip. Check in was slow. The room was a good size, had 2 comfortable queen beds and a slightly worn couch. Cleanliness was not a problem, though. The in room safe was a nice feature. Flat screen and satelite channels included. Overall, nice comfortable and quiet. Free valet parking and free self park. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: flipxicana
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the tower rooms for 2 nights, 8th floor. VERY clean and refreshing when we walked in from the Vegas summer heat. Big rooms. Bathrooms are a little cramped..very good value for what we paid..54.00 bucks for 2 nights! And one of those nights was a Friday! Only thing I hope is the El Cortez gets a pool soon that what make it even better!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool17
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas every year with my girlfriends and this year we wanted to experience more of the old Vegas so we stayed at the El Cortez. It was just what we were looking for. You can't beat the price. The hotel is one of the original Bugsy Malone hotels and it certainly looked older, but for the price and location it was perfect. Even though it was an old hotel our room was clean, and it was a very short walk to the old Las Vegas strip. They still had the old coin slots which gave it the feel of old day casino. The staff were friendly, and we would definately stay again. If you're looking for something updated, polished, and more flashy this is not the hotel for you. Every night there is a light show on the old strip, I think it's every 10 or 15 min. There is a Zip line that goes from end to the other which is a lot of fun, and it's easier to go from one hotel to the other because they are not as big as the hotels up on the new strip. To get to the other end of the new strip a cab ride would be about $25 or you can buy a 24hr bus pass for about $7. This is a great way, if you are not in a hurry, because you can jump on and off when ever you want.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights in tower room”
Reviews.Author: 16gauge
Reviews.Content: This most recent visit to Las Vegas was our 6th in the last few years. While we generally prefer to stay at the GN, we prefer to spend most of our gambling time at the El Cortez. This trip would be different. We had 5 nights comped at a strip hotel. We doubled booked two nights at El Cortez using the summer vacation package ($50/night for the rooms, with $50 in free slot pay and $50 in food credit). The room was dated, but clean. We found the bed to be too soft, but not uncomfortable. Nice view of the Strat tower from the 10th floor room. I would rate the room as on par with some others we have been in downtown (4 Queens, Fremont), but lower than the GN. For the right price, I would stay again. If rates are not much different than the GN, then I would go back there. I rate it as a solid "average" - not outstanding, but not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “We are staying again!”
Reviews.Author: Bessie67
Reviews.Content: We thought the price was so cheap it cant be nice!! Well as we plan our trip back 1 year later...there was only one hotel with the most bang for our buck! Really nice rooms, staff was nice and just a very short walking trip to downtown (very lit up for our walk also!) great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great value and a nice place”
Reviews.Author: 55JT
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay downtown this time and got a great deal on a "Cabana Suite" room for 3 weekend nights. While I wouldn't call it a suite, it was a very nice room with a nice bathroom and a fabulous shower. The slots seemed "looser" and were quite friendly to me. The ElCo is block or so from the Freemont Experience and the walk was pleasant and safe. The Sports and Race Book paled in comparison to the Hilton or the Belagio from an esthetics point of view, but they showed the same games and races and booked the same bets. I really have no gripes with my stay here and would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a great stay at El Cortez”
Reviews.Author: C0usinEddie
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th or 5th time staying at the el Cortez and once again it was a great time. They are down to earth people and always easy to work with. You have to put your room key in the slot in the elevator to make it go which I liked. I was on the 11th floor so even though i put my key in the slot, I couldnt push the buttons for other floors. nice safety feature. I once again had a tower room and enjoyed it very much. Nice sitting area and the a/c worked great. i was cold at night which is rare for me when in Vegas. I booked on travelocity so my fun book consisted of a $5 dining cert plus a free drink and a $5 match play. The craps was $3 all the time. there was another table that would fluctuate but the one table was always $3 and there was usually some spots if you wanted to play. My mom loves this place and feels comfortable. She loved her room. They have small coffee pots in the rooms as well. No luck at the slots but thats no big deal. They have a number of coin in slots so if you have some left over quarters and nickles they you can play them here. the cortez cafe was very nicely redone. I ate breakfast once and late dinner once and both were excellent, fast service too which i really like. I will certainly stay here again, you just cant beat the size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Amadeus626
Reviews.Content: I've always liked this casino because it really captures the feel of old Las Vegas. The rooms (in the tower) are huge compared to what you get on the strip. The rates are always some of the best on Fremont St. If you want to get even more retro there are the "Vintage Queen" rooms from the old casino back when the whole thing was only 2 stories. These are usually a bit cheaper than the tower rooms and as advertised they only have one queen bed in them. Note that there is no elevator to these rooms, the only way to get to them is by the staircase near the front of the casino. Now if that isn't retro I don't know what is! Now realize that the El Cortez is not the strip. If you want glitz, glam and white glove service this is not the place to stay. However, the gambling is great, the drinks are cheap and the restaurants serve up suitable meals. Because it has some of the best gambling in Las Vegas it tends to attract a more, shall we say, "dedicated" gambler who come with their social security checks. Don't be alarmed by the amount of people walking around with oxygen tanks! Also, if smoke bothers you this is not the place to be. There is a lingering smell of cigarette smoke that probably dates back to the Rat Pack days! A couple extras. Right across Fremont street in front of the casino are a couple of really good, quite reasonable restaurants. The Kabob Korner has awesome mediterranean food. There is a Cuban restaurant and a take out pizza place where you can get those huge one slice pizza meals. I recommend them all! They have also opened up a lounge or two that are oddly upscale for their location. Overall, the El Cortez is a pretty nice place and a bargain for those who don't want to be pampered but also want to see what old Vegas was like.

Reviews.Title: “A really good deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Binan1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the El Cortez many times and have always enjoyed my visit with them. I have stayed at almost every hotel/casino in the city so I think I’m a good judge of hotels there. The El Cortez is an excellent budget hotel in downtown Las Vegas. I personally prefer the downtown area because it is less busy and still has all of what makes Las Vegas a great destination. A word of caution before you read too far. If you are the type of person that name brand is important to you and/or you have to stay at a mega resort where you never leave the place to see the real Las Vegas, then read no farther. This is about a place to stay that is the exact opposite. Located on the happening end of ‘the strip’!! The hotel and casino have been completely remodeled within the last few years. So has the Freemont Street area where the hotel is located. The hotel is not the up-scale experience that many people may want when they travel but is perfect for me. Some things I like about the place are: • Easy to find – Since it is away from the congestion of the other hotels the tower is easily visible from a distance. • Easy and plentiful free parking – they have two parking garages and one can even park on the street in the area. • Easy to get in and out of the place – at the bigger places on the strip one has to wait for lines, wait for traffic, wait, wait, wait. Not at the El Cortez. I can not remember having more than one person ahead of me to check in and check out is always a snap! Leaving the parking garage is also easy, as is getting on the highway to go to the airport. • Easy to get to rooms - Some rooms are actually located on the top floor of the main parking garage and are super easy to access, no hassle of walking through the casino. Tower rooms have an elevator near the one of the entrance doors, again no need to walk through the casino to get to the room (as is the case in many larger hotels) • Affordable rooms – I’ve stayed in most of the categories of rooms (not the suite) and all were clean, secure and comfortable. • Walking distance to many entertainment and meal options – I enjoy walking and I do not consider three or four city blocks a long distance. Within that distance, some even closer, there are easily dozens of choices. • No Resort Fee or other added fees – The trick of many hotels in Vegas is to quote one rate for a room then when you arrive they add on charges for things that many guests do not use, resort fee, energy surcharge, ect. The place isn’t perfect by any means but a real nice place to stay and see / experience the wonders of Las Vegas, my personal favorite destination in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Were pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ljbrx
Reviews.Content: My brother & I (both in our 50's) were loyal guests of the Sahara for years but were looking for an alternative after I went on the National Bed Bug list and saw reports on the Sahara (may it rest in peace) and came across the El Cortez(EC). We're not too concerned about a fashionable room - it's Vegas, not Tuscany. The El Cortez (EC) is downtown about a 5 min walk from Fremont Street. Very much a traditional LV experience (pre mega-resorts). Non-smoking Tower room was dated but spacious and clean. If sensitive to smoke, you may be uncomfortable, as noted above, this is a traditional hotel/casino - low table limits, friendly staff, prompt drink service, but superb smoke ventilation, not so much. Pretty decent workout room across the street in the cabana suites bldg. For the rate we paid ($35/night) the EC was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location.”
Reviews.Author: jillbozz
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. Bar had a good special and drinks were good. Room was better than expected for an older hotel. Will definitely stay again. Close walk to freemont st casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, not so great experience”
Reviews.Author: phumba
Reviews.Content: The first thing that hits you when you enter the hotel is the overpowering smell of cigarette smoke. Even in my no-smoking room the smell of smoke is strong enough to make your eyes water! The staff are unfriendly and inefficient. The room is small but cosy and at first glance, clean. It is when you start to look closely that you see the small stains on the towels and bedding, the corners in the bathroom that have been missed.... The biggest problem was the shower that did not work! A point to remember is that this hotel is very far from the strip, though there is some local entertainment. However, as I paid next to nothing for the room it was suffiecient for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Casino vintage Vegas style!”
Reviews.Author: Bobberr
Reviews.Content: After staying in a big 5* Hotel center strip the last time I visited Vegas I wanted to trie something different, after a tip and carefully checking out this site I booked El Cortez. It is really great value for money, friendly staff, 24 hour coffeeshop right downstairs with good food for an insane low price. The location of the Hotel was also above expectation with only a 5 minute walk to Fremont street where also the bus stop is which will take you to the strip or you can easily spend a whole day in that area. And yes, there where also some questionable figures walking around but I never felt unsafe. The security guards from the Hotel and the downtown area are doing a great job, even patrolling the Hotel floors. The Hotel dated back from 1941 and althoug it was renovated, it's still pretty old, so don't expect too much (except clean rooms of course) of it.If you are taking you're date on a romantic trip to Vegas or planning Honeymoon I would recommend staying at another Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, if you get a good deal on the rate”
Reviews.Author: Cynhoff
Reviews.Content: The casino could easily be in a nursing home...think wheelchairs & walkers. The room was clean & old fashion...like you are visiting your granny in Queens. If you get a great rate it is Ok for a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not our kind of place.”
Reviews.Author: Darrad79
Reviews.Content: I struggled with how to actually "rate" this hotel because its only like $27 a night during the week. Now I'm talking about the Vintage Room not the Tower Room or the Cabana Suites. We had read on a different website that the Vintage Rooms are the way to go but I guess it just depends on what kind of person you are. If your OK with a very small room that overlooks a parking garage, a casino that is mostly coin drop and smells like baby powder or old lady perfume, and senior citizens with walkers and oxygen tanks, then this place would be just right for you. And although we are in our 40's we still prefer a little more "style" I suppose. The casino seemed very low-key and boring to us. We were booked for five nights but thank god they let us out of it early and we moved on to a more exciting place.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this special treat at bargain prices in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cliph2000
Reviews.Content: This place is the bee's knees. Opened in 1941 (that's right 70 years) was opened and run by Bugsy Siegle (Look him up). It is a wonderful period piece, Las Vegas' oldest standing hotel/casino. The 3 story hotel above the casino has no elevator, real plaster walls, windows you can open and a period bath with those porcelain cross top faucet handles. If you want something more modern, they have more modern rooms that are handi-cap accessible. But if you want to sleep where the stars slept, or some mob boss friend of Bugsy, stay above the casino. The staff is very efficient and friendly. Check-in is painless.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: gerard48
Reviews.Content: wife and I stayed in a tower room for 8 nights and the room was spotless clean and the bathroom window that opens in the shower was really nice! bed was super comfy and you have to use room key to operate the elevator for extra security. a/c was quiet and worked great also. our only minor gripe was the doors slammed a lot in the hallway but that is mainly due to rude guests. we would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price in Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bob666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a buddy in a Tower room for a fantastic $10 a night deal. The room was very quiet compared to our stay at Bill's on the Strip. Hotel is a short walk from the madness of Freemont Street. Casino was like any other Downtown casino but less busy than those on Freemont Street. An excellent craps table - although winning helps :) We had an excellent 2-4-1 steak dinner at Prime (including free bottle of wine) but meal was no better than some other cheaper steak dinners (eg Ellis Island special). Car park is a bit of a hike through the casino to get to tower room lifts but quicker than some Strip hotels. Overall an older clientele compared to the Strip hotels but a great choice to experience the Downtown Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “El Cortez - My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NYYNO1
Reviews.Content: El Co is a downtown institution. Yes the hotel is old, but its friendliness and the affordability makes it the best bang for your buck, especially if you're on budget like me. I stayed in their Pavilion room for $30 on week night. Pavilion is located right above the parking structure, and it's really a motel. The room was small, but it was well maintained and very clean. The security was always around and felt very safe as well. The crowd here tends to be on the older side, with the locals outnumbering the tourists most of the time, which gives El Co a distinct local flavor. Some of you might call those locals sketchy and questionable. I call them colorful and interesting. After playing here for few nights, I made lots of friends who are regulars here. They are all good people. The dealers and the pit bosses are very nice and friendly as well, and they'll even remember your name after just few days. Every time I went into the casino, I felt welcomed. Where else in Vegas can you expect that? It may not be fancy nor glamorous, but if you like to feel at home, and if you like a homey, down-to-earth atmosphere, El Co is the place. This place has become my home away from home. I do understand, however, that some folks may not like this place for the very same reason. It's not for everyone, for sure. I had to take a point off for one flaw: No pool. I would have loved to chill out by the pool during my downtime. It's not a deal breaker though.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in downtown Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: Pattio11
Reviews.Content: We were alittle worried about staying in a older hotel just off of Fremont St. But we were really pleased when we arrived. The hotel has kept the retro look about it and has done a remarkable job of it. Sure its alittle smokey smelling but what hotel isn't? The rooms were really clean. The bathrooms are showing signs of wear. But nothing we couldn't live with. We stayed in the Pavillion Rooms and in the elevator you had to access it with your room key. No key - no access to the floors. The breezeway to the rooms was alittle noisey. You could hear housekeeping and guests talking and walking by your room. The casino was well kept and clean. The El Cortez restaurant food was excellent!!! Not bad prices and plenty to eat. They gave us 2 meals coupons good toward food $5.00 apiece. We would and will definitely stay at this hotel again in the future. We could see the Freemont light show from the balconey of the hotel. Yes, its a short walk to Freemont St. probably about block away. It was well lit and like I mentioned security is everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Over all best deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KenKansasCity
Reviews.Content: I was in a tower room 1106. Spacious King Bed Beautiful View especially night time Excellent shower head In-room safe, easy to use and did No smells wide-comfy chair and love seat flat screen tv good double secure - need key in both elevator adn rm door good freebies in funbook i.e. $5 match play 21 $5 off cafe Free drink at bar 1/2 off 10 spot $1 keno

Reviews.Title: “Very nice- inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Heartbreakh0tel
Reviews.Content: Nice stay, great food. Friendly staff. No problems whatsoever. Card/elevator review= ask for instructions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: garyDallas_Tx
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed or seen downtown in over 30 years and made a quick trip. The Fremont Street Experience was great and we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. I gave it 5 Stars as it was a great experience for the price. While this hotel is old, it is very clean, well kept and all of the employees were very friendly. The room rate was $40 a night and we were given $20 a day in free play and $20 a day in food credits. We ate at the coffe shop and the food was good and very reasonable. A complete prime rib dinner was only $7.95! Our rooms were in the Pavilion and were again old, but very clean and well kept. No window view but just a good place to spend a few days. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: germpd
Reviews.Content: First off I would not have picked this hotel if I were to log on to a Vegas travel site looking to go to Vegas. My parents have been going to this hotel for over 10 years, they are now in their 80's and started to go downtown because it is much easier for older people to move around. The big time hotels on the strip are too much for them at this late stage of life. Anyway they always ask the kids to come with them, and over time I have gone with them to the EL Cortez 3 times now. The hotel is older, but they do keep it up to date in stages. The rooms in the original building are ok, they have what you need and are what I would call no frills. The Cabana rooms on the otherhand are newer and very nice, they are in a building just accross the street and are a very short walk. The casino is like most smaller casinos in Vegas, they have all kinds of slots and things to play. The thing I dont like about the smaller casinos is the smoke, I dont smoke and at times it gets to be to much for me. When this happens I just walk to the old town strip about 2 blocks away and walk around the old original casinos there. If you do want to go to the strip the bus line is a block away and you can ride the whole strip. Well this was my first ever review so I hope to get better with them over time.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: dukesaysha
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice room with no frills stay here. The prices are very good. The only complaint i had was a 100 dollar charge that was put on my credit card by mistake. I couldnt get in touch with a manager to fix this problem and they wouldnt return my calls. Took them a week to fix this but its done now..Thank You! I did stay at the Gold Spike last year and the El Cortez beats them hands down...I wouldnt send my dog to the Gold Spike.....Do yourself and your wallet a favor and stay at the El Cortez. ....SEE YOU NEXT YEAR !!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be dissappointed,”
Reviews.Author: Leslie2525
Reviews.Content: First of all, get your coupon book, its worth it..a free drink, $5 match play on blackjack, and $5 free play on slots. We like to go to Vegas for March Madness every year sometimes with family, sometimes with friends. (Don't stop reading this if you're not into sportsbooks..) The sports book is by far the best spot in town to place bets and to watch the games too. The staff really cares about the casino and its reflected in their service. Frankie you are the best too! Thanks so much for opening the TV room for us for the KU game on Sunday! This TV room has plenty of room for groups of fans and betters, serving $1 draws, snacks, and its non smoking in the room itself. The sports book itself has ample seating compared to most any other books-downtown or the strip.
