The staff is very complementary, from the bellman, guest services, the wait staff, to the drink girls and generally....the dealers! The Hotel has two dining options, one fine dining, one 24hr place, both real decent..and a Subway too. There a couple of bars. I definitely recommend the video poker machines at the main bar..I won alot on them and there are also 4 TVs right there. They do make good martinis too by the way-good enough to buy (without playing the video games for the free drinks!) The slots are good payouts it seems, there's a whole room of nickel slots in the back of the casino that were constantly busy too. The casino has most of the tables you want too, single deck bj, pai-gow, 3 card poker, baccarat, 2 craps tables ( I don't remember the craps tables ever being $3 tables but they were not ever more than $5) 2 roulette tables (they were hot all weekend which is hard to believe I would think) The crowd there is colorful meaning, locals and downtown employees that get off work and they come to the El Cortez to gamble and unwind! There is plenty of security because the Casino is located a couple of blocks off the main Freemont area, but literally down the street. The location is great since you can get away from noise of the Freemont experience and actually get a good night's sleep-when you finally call it a night, or a day ;D We like to stay in the Cabana Suites directly behind the Casino..its part of El Cortez but its a swanky experience. Wonderful beds and pillows and the building has its own security guard out front and you have a walkway, that traffic stops for you to cross. Its super close, I even saw a guy with a walker going to and fro the casino! You also must use your room key to access the building. Finally, may I also suggest the restaurant directly across the street on Freemont. It's called Mamita's and has Cuban and mexican food, also has music videos playing, its loud but it definitely keeps the patrons entertained! We will stay at El Cortez anytime we're in Vegas, downtown. Like someone else's review stated, the El Cortez is vintage downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The El Cortez is where it's at!”
Reviews.Author: AliciaRJ
Reviews.Content: The El Cortez is a cozy wonderful place to stay downtown Las Vegas. It is away from all the tourists on the strip. But, it has everything you need. The rooms in the Tower and their Cabana Suites are very nice & comfortable. The casino is the best place to gamble & eat. They offer great rates on tables, the best machines, and really tasty inexpensive food. The club they have is the best around. We get offers to stay for free each season for 3 nights. They also have days where you can get 3-5 times points while you play. My family has been going there for over 30 years and we never stay or gamble anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Easy Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marydistantharbor
Reviews.Content: I generally enjoy downtown Hotels and/or Historical hotels undergoing transformations ~ This one has a colorful crowd enjoying the Casino and exceptionally quiet rooms though located a close but in the Fremont Entertainment District. Valet car parking ( self parking is available ) works but it seems like (1) persons is always scheduled so you made need to wait. My checkin process had to be the longest ever due to Reservation not being found whether by name or number; something to do with Southwest Air booking process with Orbitz? Room is clean, except shower out is rather nasty, and bed is comfortable. Coffee Shop is a fun and social experience ~ wait staff is friendly, crowd is entertaining, and food is fast & tasty; except bring your id if you wish to charge to your room. Internet is charged and since it is against my personal desire to pay for WIFI, I visited the Emergency Arts building across the street and the Beat Cafe for morning coffee ($1.00) and the news.

Reviews.Title: “Good room”
Reviews.Author: PHX4ME
Reviews.Content: Good hotel overall. Big room with sitting area and desk. Just steps from Fremont St & LV Blvd in downtown Vegas. Both check-in and check-out desk folks were friendly. Bed was comfortable with new pillows and sheets. Price was dirt cheap for Thurs/Fri/Sat night in Vegas! Any of the other hotels downtown and off-strip would have been twice or three times the price easy. Good savings overall.

Reviews.Title: “For Cocktail Hour Drinks - excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Cornishprincess
Reviews.Content: We spent an terrific cocktail hour here on a weekday between 5-7pm drinking 2 for 1 Martinis one afternoon. Best Dirty Martinis in this world! Well Worth it for that.

Reviews.Title: “The Special Vintage Room”
Reviews.Author: QenTerra
Reviews.Content: I lucked out this time and scored one of the few top vintage rooms. For $20 a night the room pictured is what I received. A large quiet comfortable room. My luck playing slots here continued to be better than other casinos. Book online and you get a fun book which included $5 off at the cafe which gave me a $2.95 prime rib dinner, $5 free slot play and a free drink among others. Plus, the El Cortez gave me 2 free nights for latter use for booking online. If I remember right book 2 or more nights in Jan, Feb or March 2011 and get 2 free nights in April. So I guess my next stay will be free. The staff was wonderful to me and certainly nothing was missing from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Nardz
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times and will continue to do so. Stayed four nights on this trip. Even when my company pays for a room on the Strip, I still book a room here for one night, out of my own pocket. Rooms are clean and really all you need to explore the downtown area. Cheap gambling is awesome. Dealers and pit bosses were very friendly. As far as the smokiness goes, I can't comment, because I'm one of those jerks that is smoking right next to you. Never had a problem with housekeeping, but I also make sure to secure my belongings (as you would in any hotel). Front desk was helpful with rental car, etc. Ages in our group were from late 30's to early 70's, and not one of them had a complaint. Never felt unsafe as they are cleaning up this area (10 years ago was a little shady). Good location to hit up the Western and Atomic Liquor, too.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and waiting to die”
Reviews.Author: socialwrkr
Reviews.Content: So so..we stayed in the tower. The suite was not a bad size for Vegas, sofa was worn. You could see hand and lets just say "interesting" prints on the windows. Crank window in bath for the smokers. There is a edge all around the room and in the hall of dust where it is not vacuumed. No coffee or cups in our room on arrival. Staff at the front desk was friendly. They do offer a shuttle to the airport if you ask for it. Very smoky in the casino. Food is not bad in the cafe...majority of servers are great.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: duffytoo
Reviews.Content: Wife and I were comped a tower room for 3 nights and as with our first stay, found it quite enjoyable. We were offered a room at the Cabana suites, which are reportedly nicer, but we like staying where we gamble. Room was very clean. Bed was quite comfortable. Staff is always friendly to us and this time was no exception. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends. Casino is much nicer since renovation several years ago. I used to hate it because of smoke. BEST BLACKJACK IN VEGAS.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: ladyinred60
Reviews.Content: This place is a nightmare! Employees stole from us, there was a jamaican dealer who was staring at us like she wanted to kill us as we walked by. Then there was a hip hop party blaring in the room next door. We complained and they asked them to turn down the music they did for maybe 10 minutes and then blaring again finally asked to be moved at 2 am since they were not going to make them stop. I know Vegas is noisy but you would expect an extremely loud party to be dealt with. Believe it was an employees party as all their security seemed to be thugs as well. Also the smell of the rooms is sickening. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking hotel smells awfully”
Reviews.Author: and7ey
Reviews.Content: Regardless of the fact that this is non-smoking hotel (or we had non-smoking room), the rooms smells like somebody smoked there for years. And, probably, not even cigarettes. It smells so that you even can not sleep first. Also, everything is a little bit broken in the room. Drawer, bath etc. You can use it, but it is broken a little. Very-very old hotel and everything there. Even people playing in the casino are old (!). And, from the window of our room we saw only parking )).

Reviews.Title: “Employees steal”
Reviews.Author: cmsnig
Reviews.Content: I accidentally left cash in my room after checkout (I know that was my fault) but I realized it before the room was cleaned. When I called and explained to the front desk, they said I needed to speak with housekeeping. However, I was given the run around. By the time someone finally connected me with housekeeping (hours later), they claimed there was no money found. The person I initially spoke with should have sent someone (or gone themself) to the room immediately to retrieve the money. But, it seems like they saw this as an opportunity and they really didn't care that I had left it. Also, hotel's kind of old and decrepit and out of the way; didn't feel like a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Las Vegas wins with the El Cortez Hotel and Casino!”
Reviews.Author: Widad2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights early December 2010. I am a non-smoker and it didn't seem smoky as many reviewers have stated. I know people smoke in the casino so I understand I may smell smoke. But it didn't seem any more noticeable then any other hotel downtown. Seems people are unfair to say they "couldn't breathe" in the casino. As far as the casino, Bj pays 3-2 and many tables to choose from. Dealers were reasonably friendly. Fremont seems to have more friendly dealers. I was about to sit at the $25 table that had just one player, as i was about to sit the casino manager told me that it now changing to $100 table. I then had to play at a $5 table since they had no $25 tables open. I did not think that was good customer service. My play at the EC did change from that moment on. I did play a lot at the Fremont as they had a $25 table open. The EC do a great job with the promos. Great players card rewards and free room offers. Also, a great fun book at check in. They do try to get your repeat business. The hotel...I booked rooms in the towers for a stay in Aug and a stay in December, the most recent I was on the 12th floor and was very happy! Didn't have any odors and was clean and had plenty of light. Also had a loveseat by the window overlooking a great view of the strip. Had complimentary newspapers to read with the free coffee they provided. A nice perk! Window in the shower, that was great! High quality towels, not the cheap thin scratchy kind. They are making a good effort to win your loyalty! House keeping was so, so friendly as was the front desk. The beds were very comfortable and clean. Loved the all white bleached bedding! So glad they don't use the gross bed spreads that many hotels still use. Good selection of tv channels and being a couple blocks away from the strip the rooms are quiet. "No Fremont experience noise" and no loud pool music noise as they have no pool! Once I returned home, I did call and talk to the front desk manager about a fun book concern and he was very friendly and professional. He explained fair answers to my concerns and made me glad to have been a customer of this hotel. Overall... you can't beat the price, perks, service and rooms at the EC. I look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Deal of all deals!”
Reviews.Author: msabc
Reviews.Content: We got the Vintage Queen room and it was clean, updated, and perfectly fine for under $50 bucks a night. You have to walk through the old casino ( a smokey scene), but it is worth it considering the screaming deal of the room itself. They also offered us a free night the last day we were there. If we hadn't had a flight out we would have taken them up on it. How much time are you going to spend in your room anyway?!!

Reviews.Title: “You'll never forget the smell”
Reviews.Author: johnnylawless
Reviews.Content: The El Cortez is old Vegas - and I mean OLD. There is a fragrance they use to cover those years of smell and it is tolerable for a few days but not any more than that. We have stayed here a few times and the old motel rooms are not worth it at any price - just don't do it. More recently we tried the new "junior cabana suite" with a Las Vegas Advisor coupon. The cabana suites are actually across the street from the El Cortez. However, you still must check in at the El Cortez and then haul your stuff across the street. One interesting thing is that the rooms are numbered oddly so make sure you ask where your room is before you take the elevator to the 7th floor because you assumed #705 is up there. The junior cabana is small but nicely furnished and they are very proud of the flat-screen televisions that take up a large chunk of the room - so if you came to vegas to lie in bed watching tv - these are great rooms. Also, a nice touch was the free candy dish in the lobby - they also had a free fruit bowl with apples and bananas. The neighborhood is not for everyone and if you are not comfortable walking amongst street people you should not attempt to stay here. It is a short walk to Fremont street but the security guard warned my wife to hold onto her purse tightly because there are a lot of "crazy people" around. There is a nice looking cafe with wireless internet across the street from el Cortez that looks like a great hangout. And if you like NY style Pizza there is a local Italian shop nearby on old Fremont that serves great pizza - we ordered one takeout and took it to our room to watch a game. It is the casino that has that old smell I talked about earlier - not the new cabana suites. I can't stand to be in it so I don't gamble there.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is BAD”
Reviews.Author: daddyrabbit4
Reviews.Content: You enter the lobby to find the smell of cigarette smoke choking you. Throughout the lobby area the smell was terrible. The rest of the lobby and casino smelled of a mixture of disenfectant and perfume. You enter your room to find the carpet with burn holes and stains. I was put up in this place by the City of Las Vegas while working for them. How cheap can you be Vegas. $45.00 a night and you wonder if they clean the place. Kept checking the bedding for bed bugs it is that bad. Do Not Stay Here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: budgetqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 6 nights, booked through a Vegas discount site for average of $34/night. Was "upgraded" to the tower rooms, which were very nice, roomy and clean. The location was excellent, and easy walk from the Freemont St Experience and buses. I used a car rental for two days, which was picked up at the Freemont and 4 Queens Hotel, again, extremely convenient for outside Las Vegas touring. From the airport, the 109 bus, for $2 stopped across the street from the hotel, on Odgen, which is a significant savings compared to a taxi. The hotel had a comp, limo BACK to the airport at your departure- with advance reservations. We used the city buses, both the Duse and Express bus, with absolutely no complaints. :) This hotel was an excellent value and we had a very well maintained room. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A winner!”
Reviews.Author: stephen1944
Reviews.Content: I simply enjoyed virtually every aspect of my stay there which stretched on and off for two weeks, from check-in, to the funky rooms, ease of parking, to the fabulous location right on Fremont Street. The sole flies in the ointment was the $12 daily wi-fe fee, as well the gamblers in the casino. A rather seedy lot in general, but I didn't spend much time there anyway. I also never sampled the food. Rooms, from the surprisingly elegant vintage rooms to the smile-inducing, very outrageous green cabana suites, were immaculate and the cleaning staff friendly. The same could be said for those staffing the front desk. I'm heading back to Vegas next month for four weeks and will spending weekdays at the El Cortez, but will retreat elsewhere on weekends when rates can soar into the stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dave12933
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend there it was alot of fun. The room was real nice I liked the fridg. I went to the steak house first time I had to pay for everything I ate seperate. I would give my meal a fair. The coffee shop the prime rib is great and a good price. Loose slots in casino I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “good for the value”
Reviews.Author: JAGordon
Reviews.Content: Its not a plush hotel, but for the low price, its a very good deal. Beds were clean and comfy, had everything we needed. The only thing that was bad was that you could hear every door slam and a lot of hallway noise, its loud enough to wake you all through the night. Bring earplugs. If you're a non-smoker and sensitive to smoke, the casino may bother you, it didnt seem to be ventilated as well as some of the others. The valet parking is super nice and fast. The location is great if you plan on spending most of your time in the Fremont St. area,. just a short walk to everything. I didnt try the steakhouse, but ate in the cafe a few times, it was average, The best part about this location was tha it was super easy to get to. You can bypass the 2 hr trip up Las Vegas Blvd by taking Interstate 15.. the exit is only a few clocks from the hotel, made traveling to and from airport really easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: IowaMaddie
Reviews.Content: We had read some negative reviews about the El Cortez so were not sure what we'd find. It was wonderful. The staff was great, hotel very clean, large smoke free tower room with no smoke smell, couldn't come up with a complaint if I tried. Have stayed on the strip one time and now downtown in the older district. Enjoyed this much more. Everything was less expensive, especialloy food. Loved the experience and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't JUDGE a bOOK by it's Cover...”
Reviews.Author: rojones73
Reviews.Content: Rental i was renting downtown in a highrise loft went belly up..foreclosed...found myself without a residence for a short time period and searched frantically online for somewhere i could call home for a small bit of time and also stomach the cost... Never would i ever think of staying in an old school downtown hotel especially on Fremont...but El Cortez room rates were $14 a night..(Gold Spike was $7 night)...remembered hearing rumor about remodel and said what the hell...I couldn't believe i stayed there for $80 for 5 days and had a room at their Cabana Suites...across the street from the regular hotel is a 5 story new building EC CABANA SUITES...HOLLYWOOD Regency meets South Beach and Art Deco with LA STYLE...Kartell lighting..black and white tile floors, Kohler bathroom fixtures., 42" flat screens, cable (showtime and the movei channel), minibar, fridge, ipod dock station, great bathroom amenities, ultra hip and modern...hallways are a floral pattern with great mix of modern colors...lobby is ultra cool...modern Taschen coffee table books to peruse...candy dish by door for that sugar rush...totally secure..guard outside at all times...key entry into building... you won't believe it until you see it...suggest getting the Cabana Junior Suite,...EL CORTEZ is my new spot!!

Reviews.Title: “PICTURES!! What a nice surprise!! I put...”
Reviews.Author: tickerlock
Reviews.Content: PICTURES!! What a nice surprise!! I put their customer service to the test, both reps were very patient and calm as well as friendly. The room, for it being an older hotel......its VERY nice! I'd compare it to best western. I got a tower room, 4th floor (408) I gotta admit, it served its purpose well. The king size bed and 4 pillows was nice and comfy. The tv has, 25 channels or so. No microwave, no fridge but other than that? I'd be back guaranteed! OH! Be ware, the front desk will want a cc, refusal requires a 100$ cash deposit (for incidentals) the elevators require room key to be swiped (for security)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. And clean!”
Reviews.Author: CCC_Samuelsson
Reviews.Content: Book online for very cheap rates. Rooms were spacious and clean.With safebox. Located right on Fremont Experience, downtown Las Vegas. No frills, clean and relaxing hotel with casino. Our room had a great view of Vegas and the Strip. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, pleasant stay at the El Cortez”
Reviews.Author: duffytoo
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice and clean. Traveled with a Southwest Airlines vacation package and specificly asked for the El Cortez because we gamble there quite a bit. Nice surprise and will stay there again. Asked for non smoking and got it.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Expect anything over the top”
Reviews.Author: Lethia13
Reviews.Content: This place was a gem for the money. We spent $100 bucks for the room or the entire time we were there- 4 or 5 nights and ut served its purpose: sleeping and eating. the restaurant left MUCH to be desired so make sure you order the food and dont let your thoughts wander to the cleanliness of the kitchen, the chef, etc etc..... the place has a stale smoke smell and was filled with senior citizens, so if you're looking for hustle and bustle type of casino- IT AINT IT. trust me. =) But I did good on the live Keno and look forward to going back to hit the game again. Be sure you already have a game plan on where you want to go and what you want to see because there are no happenings here. I would recommend to anyone because, as stated earlier, it served it's purpose... a place to lay our heads and to grab a quick bite and get out to the true partying that we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “When they said "Old Vegas" they weren't kidding!”
Reviews.Author: ChippyChop55
Reviews.Content: It's a cool casino and decent hotel. Place was clean and very "old school" looking. My only problem with the El Cortez, and it was a huge one, was the cigarette smoke. Just about every 15 minutes or so of being in the casino I had to vacate to get some refreshing 109 degree air from outside. My eyes burned and teared because the smoke was so thick. Ceilings are kinda low in places and the filtration system must not be the newest on the block. Vegas seems to be the last bastion of being able to puff away anywhere you want and it is time for Nevada, in general, Las Vegas, in particular, and the El Cortez to wake up to the fact that the majority of Americans do not live with a ciggy hanging out of their mouths anymore. The Rat Pack are all dead and the 60's are gone for good.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: LinOz
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel appealed to us.The room was spacious,clean,&charming.We will stay here everytime we come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is not for Non-Smokers!”
Reviews.Author: blumoon68
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel was perfect! Right on Fremont Street only a block or so from The Fremont Experience but we could not get away from the Cigarette smell! We were in a Non-Smoking Room but it didnt matter it smelled very strongly of Cigarettes! I can handle to smoke in the Casino but in a Non-Smoking Room, I just did not expect it to be so bad! Also, the AC was not working! Customer Service Desk did send someone out to look at it but did not help! Had it set at lowest temp but was probably 85+ in there all night! I suggest to anyone who stays here, non smokers especially, to ask for a room that is detatched from the Casio! Also I think they should keep a few Fans on hand for just in that case! Im not sure I would stay here again! Definately NOT for kids! We also booked a room with a King size bed but only got a Queen! Rooms definately smaller then they look in the pictures online!!!! No Fridge or Microwave or even a desk to sit with a computer!

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad”
Reviews.Author: ladybea60
Reviews.Content: We went to this Hotel on 7/14/10- 7/16/10 for our 41st Anniversary and checked in and was told there was no smoking rooms after we had requested a smoking room, I even called ahead to see if they had smoking rooms and was told that they did have them. Was told by the check in clerk they are a none smoking Hotel. The rooms are terrible the bath tub looked like it was stained into the tub, the casino does not have a good choice of playing machine unless u like poker or 1 cent machines. I was willing to forgive all that until our last day when I tried to get a cup of coffee while at a machine and was told by the waitress "That is not my section and do not touch me" all I did was tap her on the shoulder to get her attention. Went and talked to a manager about this and was told by him "They just woke up and may be a little cranky that's just the way it is". We spent a lot of money there, we booked through Allegiant's Air. I don't mind the none smoking but let me know before hand and give me the option to get a smoking hotel, I feel like they decieved us to get the business and to make you come down stairs to smoke so you will play the machines, and that is wrong. No place to sit and smoke and it's too hot outside.I give the Sub Shop there a A+ the only good experince I had there the ladies was nice. The food in the Resturant was not good but the service was OK. Oh yes the sink in the bath room made a bubbling sound like waterr draining all night, the air did work and the bed seem clean, the room smelled musty, a little air febreze goes a long way.Bottom line I wa so unhappy. So the El Cortez for me you get an F-- You need to change the way your Hotel is ran, and be honest with people up front, and stop lying to get the business. If the workers don't like their job then GET ANOTHER ONE BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT GOOD WITH THE PUBLIC. One other waitress was also rude when I moved to another machine she told me when I tried to get a cup of coffee or some water to take my meds "I just left there and I have to do my up stairs area". Well she never came to me and I was sitting and playing at a machine. So I went to the Sub Shop and bought a cup of water to take my meds I am glad I did not have a real bad medical problem because I would have not been able to take my meds. "Just thought you would like to know how we was treated while we was there." I am 59 yrs old and my husband is 60 yrs old and a retiered Air Force serviceman have traveled the world and never seen service like this. Would like to here from some one. Thanks Bob & Bea Arnold VERY UNHAPPY CUSTOMERS.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MajorBlow
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the good comments already written. I had a king bed on the 12th floor of the tower - booked through 1800 Hotels.com - 5 nights for £97 which included the 4th July holiday weekend. Large rooms with lots of furniture to stow your things away; writing desk; ample room to stow your luggage; room safe big enough for a 15" laptop; good sized bathroom; clean, everything worked; nice view. I requested a refridgerator and one was wheeled up within the hour. WiFi was available but not included in the room rate. A flat 24hrs cost $11.99. All the staff were pleasant and friendly... many of them having worked for the hotel a number of years. Clientel tended to be regular locals and predominently 'older', unlike the hoardes of overseas young tourists in the strip hotels. I only once saw children in the casino and they were part of a family heading to the cafe for a meal. I liked that the slots and tables were well spaced in the casino, so there was ample room to move around. The decor was low key unlike the bright glitz and glamour of many strip casinos - so unobtrusive on the eye. Security was ever present and reassuring. The food was good value altough you might on occasion have to wait for it. The $7.95 rib meal offered good value although I couldn't eat it - all the steaks were bought-in pre-rubbed with pepper, and pepper is something I can't stomach. You could use your accumulated points from your casino membership card to pay or part pay for meals, and all new arrivals were given 3 x 50% coupons to use in the cafe. The location was just 2 short blocks aware from the Freemont Experience where it was easy to pick up the Deuce or Ace buses to go up the strip or down to the shopping outlets. Noticed a couple of vagrants in the general area at night but nothing to be afraid of. Just across the street from the casino was a handy convenience store. I couldn't hear any noise from the Freemont Experience at night and enjoyed a comfortable nights sleep every night. I made a point of visiting many of the strip hotel casinos and as a comparison they were very crowded and far noisier. Outside you had crowds on the sidewalk to negotiate. So I was very pleased with my choice of hotel and would stay again. The El Cortez has a lot in its favour and was voted by one of the local magazes as best downtown hotel 2009. I would definitely stay again and have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone looking for a 'down to earth' best value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The machines could not have been any tighter!”
Reviews.Author: GamblingMan69
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Las Vegas to gamble I would stay FAR AWAY from the El Cortez. I have been going to Las Vegas for years and have NEVER experienced machines tighter then in this place. There are signs hanging all over the casino telling you how "loose" their machines are, but as I experienced first hand this could not be further from the truth. Do you like cops? If not then don't stay at the El Cortez. Why? Because they are everywhere. However not for your security, but to keep the riffraff out of the place. When we stayed there last week we watched the police kicking in the door at the Motel 6 across the street along with several other arrests we saw in just a short 3 day stay. If you plan on visiting Las Vegas to gamble BEWARE of the El Cortez!!

Reviews.Title: “Give this downtown gem a shot.”
Reviews.Author: Falstaf11
Reviews.Content: This is my third time at the El Cortez and my second time staying in the tower. I have stayed in the Cabana Suites, stayed in a Tower Suite and this time I stayed in a Tower King room. The rooms are nicer, bigger and more affordable than similar rooms I have stayed in on the strip. Check in was a breeze and you simply will not get better food for the price than you will get at The Flame. The prices are insanely low. I'm one of those people that gets kind of nervous when I see a steaks priced in the low 20's and huge sides for under five dollars, but honestly, the food is awesome. The decor in the room needs a little help, but who cares? This was my longest trip to Vegas, almost two weeks, and I always felt at home and really appreciated the staff. Give this place a shot, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the money”
Reviews.Author: BarbMadison
Reviews.Content: My new hubby and I needed a get away, so we booked the El Cortez for a week. We booked for the price and held our breath not knowing what we would be getting into due to mixed reviews. I have been to Vegas many times knew about where the hotel was located, which is about a block off The Fremont Expierence. This made me a bit nervous as once you get off the beaten path for tourists, it can get a bit scarey. Rest assured at no time did we feel threatened, one thing that was nice was the El Cortez had a security guard outside the entrance where you would come out to go to Fremont Street. We seen a lot of patrols by police officers on bicycles too. As far as the rooms went I booked one of the rooms on second floor above the casino. Believe me, there are no elevators to this floor. We had some heavy luggage when we got there, which was late at midight, and had no problem having the bell hop take our luggage up the steps. The room although small, was very nice. It looked to me as if they were trying to preserve the old Vegas feel with the dark woods and old fashioned look dressers. Everything was clean and neat and nothing seemed in need of repair. I would have to say there were only two negatives I could think of and one would be the view, which was a roof top and another building. The other thing was ocassionally, not all the time you could smell smoke, I imagine because of being right above the casino floor. We used the Valet for parking the whole time we were there, they were quick and friendly, but I did understand there was free off street parking. All in all we will stay there again if the occasion arrises.

Reviews.Title: “We were happy, and here are PRO's, CON's and recommendation to owners!”
Reviews.Author: nancyadams
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to come over to Las Vegas for several days, and decided I wanted to spend our money on FOOD first, then GAS AND ENTERTAINMENT, and the lodging last. But....that didn't mean I was going to accept any old hotel. So when I read about El Cortez, PLUS saw that coming in May meant a third night free, it was the choice. And in spite of being an older hotel, plus being right off downtown, we were NOT disappointed! Stayed on 5th floor of tower. PRO'S: 1) HUGE room with two nice queen beds, a couch area, and a fine bathroom. Clean 2) Small handy safe in bathroom area--easy to use 3) Friendly bellhops 4) LOVED the carpet in the casino and check-in area 5) Just two easy-walked blocks from fun, covered downtown area 6) Nice fancy outdoor entrance and good valet service 7) Quiet and slept well CON'S: 1) These particular rooms do not come with microwave or refrig 2) Way too smoky in Casino due to older poorer ventilation 3) Noticed that winnings were few and far between in casino 4) Valet parked our car OUTSIDE in full view of strangers and weather RECOMMENDATIONS TO OWNERS: 1) CLEAN the hallway carpets along the base boards!! 2) Improve the food, ambiance AND service in your restaurant. Not impressed and we simply drove elsewhere to get it all. Sad, since we could have given YOU that money 3) Aw c'mon--nothing wrong with providing microwave and refrig 4) Second aw c'mon--have maids leave little chocolates on pillow instead of NOTHING. Little things DO make a difference. Will we stay again? Only if we need to save money, since the room rates were low and nice and I did enjoy the friendly employees. And being in walking distance of the hip downtown area was great. But the food situation really needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “El Cortez Revamped”
Reviews.Author: BabyBoomer56
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days at the El Cortez and absolutely loved it. Did a walk thru over fifteen years ago, and boy has it changed! Stayed at their Pavillion across the streeet from their main casino/hotel and would highly recommend it. Was a bit leary about being at the end of the Freemont St. action and across the street from the casino/hotel, but my fears were set aside by the fact that a security guard was posted outside the Pavillion and another male figure directly inside the first entry door. You must also use your room pass card to access the building. Room had 42" flat screen, pillow top bed with three king size pillows, mini fridge, coffee maker and deluxe super huge shower, wow. My first ten minutes in the casino I hit on the Double Diamond quarter machine, fity cent bet got me two hundred dollars in quarters. Fun! Their loose slots were mesmerizing. HIt again at the last minute when I had to leave the hotel on their free shuttle to the airport. I was pleasantly surprized to find that shuttle was a comfy Lincoln and not a busted up passenger van. Any problems with my room were remedied ASAP. Employees were cheerful and very accommodating. Service in 24 hour cafe was quick and sweet. I would recommend this hotel/casino to everyone, including solo older females like myself. Give it a twirl.

Reviews.Title: “Scary for women”
Reviews.Author: Linzerella99
Reviews.Content: I checked in with myself and my 15 year old niece. I was told they were sold out and I got the last room. We were sent to our 5th floor room to find the elevator opened to an outside "motel like" area. The hallways were dark and noisy. Once we got to our room, we were frankly scared to leave and go back into the dark hallway. The room was creepy and very old, needed renovating. I immediately called a near casino that I knew would cost a bit more but I knew would be safe. I dont know how the El Cortez had received rave reviews in the past???? When I went to check out they finally offered me a different "safer" room. It was too late to save me as a guest as I had requested an upgraded room at check-in and was denied.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again - nice clean room.”
Reviews.Author: tinkielynn
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and am 100% honest with my reviews. El Cortez is a good hotel with good and bad features. You have to figure out what is important to you. The cost is affordable. The rooms (we were in room 1205) were remodeled and very clean. Our sheets were soft, bright white and clean and the double beds in our room were comfy. Our towels were the same. The furniture in the room is dark wood and was like new. Our maid was wonderful. She vacuumed every day. When we arrived there was no refrigerator in the room so we called downstairs and asked for one and within 5 minutes, they wheeled one up on a scratched up mini black one on a gray cart (not attractive, but hey, it was a fridge). When I needed a hair dryer, one call to the guest services and it was delivered asap. Also, we needed some paper coffee cups and bingo again- within a few minutes they were delivered. Service was excellent in that respect. There was no microwave in our room (and we did not ask for one). The location is right in the heart of Freemont – a very old town Vegas atmosphere. At mid-night, you can watch& hear the 5-minute Freemont light show from the side of the hotel and it’s worth staying up for. Upon arrival at El Cortez, the valet folks are really nice and helpful. We actually choose to self-park (because of a rental catr I am picky about who gets behind the wheel). The bellman is a different story. The older shorter white man was very nice but was not able to tell us on a map how to get to Fire Valley or Grand Canyon, and the taller black bellman was horribly rude beyond belief to my handicap niece who walks with a cane. We went to the store and upon return needed to borrow is luggage cart to tote in bottled water for her and he said no – he did not lend it out even though we were staying in the hotel. What? Did he think we were going to steal it? Strange and rude all at once. We ended up carrying up a bottle at a time each time we came and went from our car. That was very inconvenient. The folks working at the concierge desk were super nice also and explained our comps (they give you a book of neat comps at check-in). The self-parking garage is detached from the casino/hotel but we felt 100% safe. There were security people all about and a guard standing at the exit of the garage where you walk to the casino. They have ramps and elevators, so handicap people do just fine. The elevator has a slot to put your key car in before you press your floor number. I liked that bit of added security. There was a one-cup coffee pot in the room and they give you 2 packets of coffee and condiments each day. There were soaps, shampoos, conditioners and lotions as well. Only one night did any noise bother us, Tuesday I think when we heard extra loud Freemont Street music – just 1 night out of 6. The 12th floor hallway smelled funky but the room did NOT, it was perfectly fine. You can smoke in the hallway and probably in the room but we did not. The bathroom has a detached area for primping – which I like. The rub is not made for extra tall people (at least in room 1205). I am 5’3” and it was perfect, but the nozzle would hit a 6 foot person on his chest I bet, and not over his head. It was very clean, but there were no exhaust fans, only a side window to open within the tub area to let our steam (it worked). The view from our room was ok – you could see the strip at a distance, but so many tall buildings blocked any new strip stuff, no balcony and window did open but with secure bar so only 2 inches. The slot machines did not pay me too well, but I only gambled in our hotel two or three times and not with a lot of money (I think less than 20 each time) so I never gave them a fair chance. We did not eat at El Cortez, so no comments there. The tv did have a lot of channels, we just didn’t watch them very much. Oh, when the A/C kicked in, it scared us almost every time, a big clunk sound. I did notice a lot of older patrons, but it did not matter, who cares when you are gambling. The drive to the main strip where the new/big casinos are is under 10 minutes. WiFi Internet available in your room for $12 a day, ridiculous. Bottom line, we were in the room very little, just to sleep and it was clean and quiet. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover999
Reviews.Content: We've been splitting our time in Vegas between the Strip and Downtown for years, but this was the first time staying at the ElCo. Spotless, spacious room in the Pavillion section, very close to the safe, enclosed parking. The Pavillion appears to have originally been part of the parking garage, then converted to guest rooms. Certainly nothing fancy... but the bed here was actually more comfortable than the one at MGM. The nightlife at Fremont street is a must-see. Odds and drink service are better than the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and good stay”
Reviews.Author: zban
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay at El Cortez and was given a free key chain with our photos on it too. It's not a fancy hotel but it's clean and the bed was firm, so we are happy with these quality already. The price is low and fit our budget very well. Happy with our pick at that time. =)

Reviews.Title: “Don't Underestimate It!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingElTimo
Reviews.Content: I came with low expectations, but found a comfortable, well kept (though clearly worn) hotel with a pleasant staff and quaint rooms. The location is easily within walking distance from the Fremont Street Experience and the parking is free. I was a little uneasy on the streets at night as they are dimly lit and there are very few pedestrians. The restaurant is good, but nothing special. Overall, the rooms were comparable to most 3-4 star hotels I have stayed at, but for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money! Freemont street is where to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dhatton3000
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Las Vegas alone on my way to San Francisco; as I was coming to the end of my budget for travelling across America, I stayed at the El Cortez. I was worried that the distance from the strip and the cheapness of the accommodation would dampen my stay, but I was wrong. The El Cortez from the second I arrived were friendly and accommodating. My room was small, but was clean, modern and had good air conditioning (which is important in that Nevada heat!). The bus to the strip comes every 5-10 minutes from across the road from the hotel; I found that on the LV strip itself, you HAVE to take the bus anyway as the strip is so extremly long that its impossible to walk across it, so the extra 5 minute ride up to Downtown to the El Cortez hotel was nothing, and it cost exactly the same as what it would on the strip anyway. I loved staying in the downtown area; while Las Vegas Strip is exciting and worth seeing the shows; downtown freemont street provides music and entertainment. The light show is amazing. There were live bands every night, nice little bars which didn't charge the earth to drink from unlike the bars on the strip. The only thing I would say is NEVER walk to the strip from the hotel, as 1) las vegas boulavard is incredibly long and in that heat is unbearable, and 2) about a mile into the walk, you go through where all the white chapels are, and its a dangerous area and I didn't feel safe. The bus's are fantastic and so cheap that its worth it. I'd recommend a trip to the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam, which you can set up with the Greyline coach company; the coach collected me from my hotel and took me to the canyon and back. Amazing trip. The most impressive part of my trip was when I asked for the free airport shuttle the hotel provided to take me back to the airport on departure. I expected a mini bus of some kind or a van; instead they provided me with a black executive car and a driver to take me back; I couldn't believe how nice it was, and it was free. Needless to say I handed the driver a nice tip. Its cheap and cheerful and I'd recommend this hotel anyday. Don't be put off the by the pirce, as the room, while small was modern, clean and the staff were amazing. And also the downtown area is fantastic; far more exciting and entertaining than the strip

Reviews.Title: “Great place for little amount of money”
Reviews.Author: alaskatraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked online and got a great deal everyother day was free. We stayed during spring break and St Patricks day and it was tottally affordable only 64 for all 4 days. Also when you cheack in ask about the return shuttle to the airport, book it beforehand and no need to worry afterwards. We stayed in the older part but the rooms were clean and big. I mean how much room do you need in Vegas. The restauant was good but quite slow at service. Make sure you get a casino card the points add very quickly then your meals are almost free. You also get a book at checkin with some useable coupons such as the keychain with your picture on it a small nice souveriner. It is at the far end of the Freemount experince but it is a short walk to see all the sights and the nightlife. If you want a very reasonable place to stay this is it

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Old Style Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Conti1964
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel due mainly to its price , and location . The hotel is very close to the Fremont Street experience . I had a vintage room near the barbershop . Room was big , clean and comfortable if a little dated. Maid service good and overall a good place to lay your head after a late night gamble and an evening on Fremont or The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “The way Vegas used to be.”
Reviews.Author: jupthesecond
Reviews.Content: Clean. Quiet. Great location. Budget minded. My first concern for a Vegas room was price. The El Cortez met that need with exceptional promptness. Next need to be near Fremont. Then, came security. El Cortez has exceeded my expectations. The rooms are super clean and quiet. Friendly staff. The budget room I had was incredibly quiet, despite being right above the casino floor. Everything about it came right out of the '60s, though. No elevator access to the floor. Very small. (Bed, a chair and three pieces of furniture left little room to move about in. The bathroom had classic faucets, that leaked. No big issue.) To operate my netbook on an outlet, I had to purchase an extension cord to run from the bathroom, as the only other outlets were all hidden behind unmovable furnishings. It's a room for one or two. Wouldn't recommend any families. (Besides, the stairwell goes directly to the casino, where 18- kids aren't permitted.) The window would not open. But, the climate control worked quite well. TV had a decent selection of channels and was fairly modern. Has a multi-level parking garage. (And, the fifth garage level was elevator accessible rooms, which required a pass key to reach.) If you're going to Vegas to gamble the day away and catch shows all night, coming here to sleep afterwards, you've found one of the great Vegas deals. Family of five, staying over one night on the way to Disneyland...look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “North end!”
Reviews.Author: YukonMax
Reviews.Content: Did not expect much from El Cortez. My first trip to Vegas. The hotel is okay, maid service started on my third day and every day after. Bedsheets were changed 3 times in my 10 day stay. Garbage were picked up, bed made, fresh towels and toiletteries. But the floors were not vaccumed or cleaned, neither was the toilet or bath tub. It smelled like cigarette but I had requested a smoking room. Ventilation sucks. Had a room in the tower, but on 3rd floor at the back with a view of the parking lot. One day in this part of town is more then enough. One should not venture off Freemont or 1 block away from the Cortez as soon as it gets dark. The busy section of the strip is quite far and you must get a cab or take the deuce bus on las vegas blvd. Cab should never be above $20.00, average $18.00 with tip. Cheap eateries on Freemont, specially breakfast at the Fitzgerald.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ragazzo84
Reviews.Content: El Cortez is located in Downtown Las Vegas, on Fremont Street, where the old hotels/casinos are located. Not everybody who goes to Vegas go also to Fremont, but they should to! It's like another Las Vegas in Las Vegas, the old and classic casinos are fabulous! And there's easy transportation to/from the Strip. Staying in El Cortez in Fremont was an amazing experience in my trip! The hotel is also a casino, and it's big. Because it's old, there was no elevator in the part I was staying, but not a big issue, I was in the 2nd floor. The room was in classic style (not old actually, it was clean), I loved it. Unfortunately the TV wasn't working, unfortunately the WiFi is not for free. But I never paid so cheap for a private hotel room (I booked way in advance). Before arriving I was afraid of how the hotel would be, but it surprised me, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: topssuite
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay at the El Cortez and I would gamble there. Its old school Vegas and 80% of the clientele are locals. Two thumbs up for the Double Attack Black Jack.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, easy acees to alot, cool casino”
Reviews.Author: brmosaic
Reviews.Content: Under a hour on the Route 108 bus from LAS Airport to the Downtown/Fremont; Clean, Secure, Subways restaurant inside, diner was okay. Like the roulette wheels there; can make quarter bets, minimum $1; stretch your money out and enjoy. Near Fremont Street Experience with the big overhead LG screen that has shows on the hour at night. Access to the DEUCE bus, double decker bus that takes you down The Strip. 2 blocks further seems to begin the Real Las Vegas, where the people live but its all cool

Reviews.Title: “Vegas 2007”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyB3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine. We were there during a remodel, so it was a little noisy. Overall nice hotel in downtown Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Yet another very good stay at the El Cortez”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: We were back for five more nights is February and had a great time as usual. We paid extra for a tower room, but all the king-bed rooms were taken, so they gave us a Vintage Suite instead. The vintage suites are enormous and nicely furnished, with a living room area featuring a big sectional couch, 2 closets and a separate dressing room. The room looked exactly the same as the one in our photos from last year's trip. The drawbacks to the vintage rooms are that they smell a bit like a casino and they're an odd mix of lavish and cheap. For example, the bathrooms have really nice marble floors and pretty pedestal sinks--but crappy fiberglass tubs. Oh, and there's no elevator. But if you're willing to put up with a few quirks, they're a tremendous value. The casino was the same as usual--a friendly place with the best gambling in town. Of course, that's not saying much these days, as even the gambling downtown is getting pretty bad. But that's another story. They seem to have improved the drink service at the tables as well, it used to be pretty bad at night, but this time it was solidly decent. They do seem to have cut back on the parking valets though, it was a little ridiculous. I tried to park in the structure as much as possible. Overall, a great stay, looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “VEGAS, BABY, VEGAS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Electrickid13
Reviews.Content: Located at the far end of the Fremont Street Experience, not a long walk from the hustle and bustle of the Fremont Street Experience, and a short bus, taxi, or car ride from the modern day strip our generation has grown to love and inundate with our hard earned money and carnal desires. This is one of the last original hotel/casinos of the previous generations where the Rat Pack and Wayne Newton originally performed, collaborated and made (in)famous as their hang outs. Definitely a piece of Las Vegas history that needs to be experienced by all. The room is a little small-ish, but I prefer to call it cozy and especially for the price you can't ask for anything more. Your rooms are all located above the casino floor so the second you step out the smell of stagnant cigarette smoke and decades old sweat from previous generations of gamers strikes you right in the nostrils and gets you ready for that Vegas night you always imagined. Staying up all night at a Craps, Roulette, Poker, or Black Jack table, the waitress bringing complimentary free drink after complimentary free drink while you throw away or win your life savings with the throw of a dice, ball, or card. Don't let the place fool you, it might be smaller than it's big brothers and sisters up the street or down on the main Strip, but it's just as mean or forgiving as the rest... it's all in the luck of the draw. Luck be a lady tonight.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jem!!”
Reviews.Author: amilot
Reviews.Content: I deceided to treat my husband to four days in Vegas and found an awesome deal that I couldn't resist. At first I was a bit leary due to the location, but trust me when I tell you that we were both pleasantly surprised it over exceeded our expectations. The staff was very pleasant, dinner at the Flame Steakhouse perfect and daily breakfast at the Cafe Cortez more than pleantiful! We stayed at the tower and the room was very comfortable. The slots are loose and alot of fun to play longer than 10 minutes. We walked every night to Freemont and had a blast playing in the casinos along the way. We stayed at the Wynn in 1997 and this was by far more enjoyable. Would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget. This was a true Las Vegas Experience!!

Reviews.Title: “still gracious!”
Reviews.Author: mondella
Reviews.Content: I know El Cortez is in a not particularly desirable location but if you only want a clean room for a fair price, you can't beat it! They always treat me nice from the bellman, front desk, to the restaraunt! They seem to remember my face and I honestly believe my comps add up there more than any other casino. I gamble at lot's of casino's on and off strip but @ El Cortez I can see my comps adding up daily. It's really not a bad deal if you are a small fish like me. I consider a small fish a person with a $200.00 a day limit. That includes food, transportation, and entertainment. I was there for 10 days and cant wait to return. (which I am planning to do so) I live on the east coast and it is good to know I can have a good vacation and not spend a fortune. See you in April El Cortez and by the was, two of my nights will be free due to the hospitality of El Cortez for customer appreciation!

Reviews.Title: “pleasently surprised, will be back.”
Reviews.Author: jerry4444
Reviews.Content: very large rooms, i stayed in the tower rooms, got t good view of doewntown las vegas, foot at coffeee shop surprisngly good, housekeeping excelllent, staff friendly. close to freemont experience, close to hotel italian restaurant, pizza was good, greek resturant i did not try, El Cortez coffee shop open 24 hours 7 days a week.prime rib special very good, and they make chineese food per order 4-10-pm reasonable price generous servings

Reviews.Title: “Finally Stayed At ELCO and glad we did !!!”
Reviews.Author: CousiHere
Reviews.Content: My friend and I travel to Vegas 2-3 times a year and always said that we would try the El Cortez one time, because we always go there to play, but have never stayed because we couldn't find a package that included this Hotel as part of the package. Finally, we saw a great deal for air only and booked at the El Cortez for the rooms. I always see advertising for the Vintage rooms and they always say that they are smoking rooms only but they do have non-smoking Vintage rooms. My only letdown here was that I reserved (and paid for) a pavilion room, but they gave us a vintage room. I was skeptical when they gave us directions to our room, but didn't say anything to the front desk clerk, thinking I would "have a look" first. To my pleasant surprise, they weren't too bad. Clean, lots of room, bathroom could use a remodel but what the heck...we were not in the room for long over the 3 days....Love to play the roulette and slots their and also the Keno. Great people and I'm positive we'll be back soon. Keep up the good job

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price!”
Reviews.Author: fuzzy11
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price we paid which was almost free! Staff was great and the view on the 14th floor was beautiful over looking the strip. Room was very clean and big. Fremont light show was a block away only problem was all the homeless begging for money! Would stay there again is the same insame deal came around!

Reviews.Title: “Some of the last of old Vegas”
Reviews.Author: roadtripperMaryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for my wife's birthday. I had seen pictures of the exterior, with the huge neon roof sign, and convinced her that we needed to spend the vacation here. We stayed in a vintage room in the original building, which I believe was built in 1942. We were on the top floor, right behind the big vertical 'GAMBLING' sign. It was kind of like being in an old movie. The room was really big, and had two couches by the TV, and a little office by the bed. It was clean, and well furnished. Although the rooms are non-smoking, a trip to Vegas is like a trip back to the '70s. Everyone is chain smoking, and all our clothing stank. We even had to air out the luggage after we got back. Our bed was comfortable, and the street outside was quiet at night. The air conditioning was not working, but they fixed it after I notified them. The bathroom was clean, but was not as vintage as I had hoped. Instead of a '40s tile bath, we got '80s tacky. Check in and out went very smoothly, and our rate was incredibly low, $31 for the weeknights, and $40-something for the weekend. You get some good coupons at checkin for food, drink, and gambling. It is an entire two blocks from the 'Experience' of Fremont St, which I hardly considered a drawback. To get to the Strip, budget an hour, as the 'Deuce' is atrociously slow. They are bringing out an express bus early this year, which should make the trip much quicker. Food at the coffee shop was just okay, but the steakhouse was really good, and the servers were all older women who seemed to know most of the clientele. Gambling was fun, and we both made out okay for total amateurs. The drinks brought to the tables are pretty decent, and if you slip the lady a buck or two, she'll be quite attentive. For all our jokes about staying with the 'low-rollers', we really had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage room”
Reviews.Author: fatkoalabear
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights Oct.11-13. Had a Vintage room, small(but all the space I needed), clean and at a great price. Hope to come back and do it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Low priced accomodation in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mayank_bunny
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel while searching for a cheap place to stay during our trip to Las Vegas. The hotel is located in the Las Vegas UpTown and the main strip is very accessible from here via public transport. Staying here have us the opportunity to explore the Las Vegas uptown, which many travellers skip. The hotel is very cost effective and the rooms are also fine for the dollars paid. The staff is very courteous and helpful as well. The staff even arranged for a free drop to airport at the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned casino style hotel, a bit far from Fremont Street Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman-nl
Reviews.Content: Old fashioned casino, with lots of red copper and red carpets. Rooms are pretty small, but otherwise cosy furnished. Entrance looks very nice when looking to it from teh Las Vegas Boulevard. However, although located at Fremont Street, the walking distance to the busier covered part of Fremont Street is longer then is the case with other down town hotels. I would prefer comparably priced other casino motels like the Plaza or Vegas Club when I visit again. An advantage of the El Cortez is the parking arrangement: as a guest you don't have to pay and re-emburse (like is the case in some other down town hotels)

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: jenluvstravelin
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel as a last minute decision. I wish I would of spent more time doing research. First of all, check in took a very long time. Neither of the two people at the front desk seemed to care that people were waiting. Once we got done, we went to find our room with luggage in hand. Nope, nobody helped w/ the luggage and the lady gave us directions so fast I had to stop and ask three different people to get there...ok so it was only two. We got to the room and I was thinking that maybe they hated us??? We were above the parking garage and the room was the size of a closet!!! I know that in Vegas you don't spend much time in your room but I'm a little claustrophobic plus to get to these rooms you have to go outside. It was like a motel.. I did not feel safe. We quickly upgraded to a tower room (whch again took a long time but only this time because the woman who waited on us was too busy talking to her supervisor about what day she would get off for Christmas). Anywho, the tower room was only $10 more a night and so worth it. You could fit two of the previous rooms in these!! Lots of room to walk and a seating area! Also, the bathroom was huge. We did not eat at any restaurants here so I can't say anything about the food. We did gamble a little, actually we were there for awhile but were never blessed w/ a waitress' presents so we never got a drink. She would walk by and look the other way!!! So my friend and I went to Freemont and gambled at Mermaids, that is the best place to go. All kinds of fun and I won! The El Cortez is very clean and updated. We had to ask for a hair dryer and iron/ironing board but they were very quick. Still, they need to work on the service some. Next time, I'm staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: roofingman
Reviews.Content: In the past I have waited for the Deuce Bus on the downtown strip and noticed the El Cortez across the street..I thought I would stay there next time I was in town.....I liked the room it was big and bright (Tower section)....The shower and bathroom are all as previously described by other subscribers....I had to ask for a hair dryer and a fridge and got them fast -no charge.....My companion was my son (34) and as I usually pay for everything -he was the one who complained about the smell etc of the casino--go figure!!...I was happy with the place and have never smoked--dont come here if you cant abide smoking customers....The restaurant downstairs was adequate but found it was easier and cheaper to go to the buffet at the Fremont.......You will see panhandlers down the street--I found it a lot easier just to ask them for money...before they asked me........A miscreant did try to get us upset at the crap table and the casino mgr gave us a $80 dinner comp to keep us happy--It did.!........The steak house is very reasonable/romantic/good food and always ask for Shirley the waitress--shes great...!!........I love jazz and the pianists in the bar were great and would play anything I asked for....Raymond is particularly talented and was always obliging ...Please tip these fine gentlemen..........I'll be back again as I like the place in the winter...The only problem is no pool.......I will be back in a few months but will stay at the Stratosphere -only because of the pool..................

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe I waited so long to stay here”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place. This is what I hope never disappears from vegas. It is classic vegas, the rooms in the Tower are great, they have a sitting area and are really large. We had a view back at the vegas strip and the walk to The Fremont St Experience is short and safe. We ate at the cafe and it was decent food at realistic prices. Will make this place a regular stay on my return trips.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: Shilah
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a little leery of staying at the El Cortez. Received a free offer and decided to meet my daughter ,her husband and a couple of her friends there for the weekend. Told them I was not sure what to expect. Everything there exceeded our expectations. Pleasantly surprised as our cab arrived there how nice the entrance looked. We were greeted and given coupons immediately. You get a free bottle of wine with your dinner at Flame restaurant when you get your rooom key. Can't beat that. The desk clerk was speedy and friendly. We stayed in a tower room that was roomy and comfortable. Rooms have been renovated recently and our very nice. Don't have a hair dryer in the room but front desk will get you one. We actually didn't gamble anywhere else. Their point system is spend a dollar earn a point. Never have earned points so easily. earn 500 points in a day and your in a free slot tournament which is fun. Tom the bartendar by the front desk is well worth getting to know. We spent 3 afternoons with him-he remembered our drinks and was so fun to talk to. Later on Paul at the bar in the middle was a winner too.Then at the graveyard shift in the main bar is Frank. A must bartender to visit. From Brooklyn and so full of personality. His Bloody Mary"sare the best. Ended up eating all 3 dinners at the Flame. Our waitress ,Alice was one of the best. So funny and just such a good waitress. If you have her for a waitress you won"t be disappointed. Rating of the food from my group Steak Diane-exceptional. ribeye-exceptional,Strip steak-exceptiona,prime rib-beyond exceptional. Sides are enough for 2 people-macaroni exceptional, garlic masedpotatoes-great baked potato-wow, Onion soup great. Saad can be split for 2. Will I ever go there again. Yes, I can't wait. Felt like I was friends with everybody who worked there. Do you ever get that feeling on the strip. Stay there you will be pleasantly surprised at the casino not smokey great rooms and great people that work there.l

Reviews.Title: “What a change - easily the best value downtown”
Reviews.Author: phxazdave
Reviews.Content: We have been staying downtown 2-3 times per year over the last 6 years, and 6 years ago never thought the El Cortez would even be a consideration to stay in. It was a dump, dirty and delapidated, in a somewhat scary part of downtown, 2 blocks east of the Fremont Street Experience. The clientele seemed to fit the place perfectly. Smoke poured out the casino door when it opened (we smoke and we noticed the haze inside) and a foul odor hung in the air. Over the years, I would drop in there for a moment just out of curiousity. I noticed that, unlike some other downtown properties which were falling into decay, the El Cortez was spiffing up. Earlier this year, I convinced the better half to come in with me. She had vowed 6 yrs earlier never again. We ended up spending about 3 hours there, and she was shocked at the turnaround (but still skeptical). We got an offer to stay in the new Cabana Suites and (after agreeing with her that we would go elsewhere if it wasn't decent there, as well as researching their remodel, etc. on the web and showing such to her) we booked, opting for a Tower room as the Suites are non-smoking. I'm glad we did, as the Cabana Suites are also across the street, not attached to the main building. The changes are not superficial. Services were excellent all around. When we booked they gave us a room number. We arrived about an hour before check-in time and the room was ready (same room number they had given us a month earlier). Not once did we see a smudge print on the elevator panel, nor anywhere in it (although it is a pet peeve of mine, that nearly every property that has a nice big furnishing in the hall when you exit the elevator has been knicked but good by the maids vacuum and isn't touched up. Same here) . The room was large, clean (no fear of being barefoot as in some other properties) and well appointed. No flat screen TV, but it was big enough. Except for the TV, it looked just like the picture on their website (believe me, many of the other properties rooms do not). Bathroom is kinda small, but that wasn't a problem. Electronic safe is in there mounted near the floor in the closet area. You won't find amenities already in place in the room, but they're available, just call down. She needed a hairdryer and they offered to bring a frig as well. Don't see that happen often. No old noisy heat/cool unit on the floor by the window here. Output and air intake are vented from the ceiling with the control on the wall near the door. And no old 'popcorn' ceiling. Gambling was fun, great mix of new and old machines (there are still coin payouts on some, old Vegas) and the limits are low on the tables ($3 BJ with 3/2 and 25 cent roulette with $1 minimum) which is nice if you hit a cold streak. Casino was very clean at all times in the 3+ days we stayed. It was common to see not just maintenance people picking up around the place, but floor people, servers, and security as well. Machines were being wiped down and no trash and empty cups/bottles laying round them. The air was clear and no odors. Carpet and floors all clean. Fellow patrons were friendly, it has a loyal following. We ate each day at the Cafe Cortez. Great food and a lot of it for cheap (frig came in handy for leftovers). And yes, Jackie is around, he ate at the next table Sunday morning. Didn't try The Flame or the hot dog cart, but heard they were good. If you don't want to stop gambling to eat, they have a service to deliver food to you. We forgot to try that, but saw many people using it. There are still some characters in there, but that's typical downtown. Security is abundant, inside and out. Not once did we see any disturbance. The short walk to the Experience is plenty safe, day or night. We walked one night to Binion's to eat at the coffee shop there (sure glad we did, as unfortunately it will be gone in a couple of weeks) and had no problem at all. But the fact is, we enjoyed the El Cortez so much, that was the only time we left the property. Bottom line, the El Cortez ranks #2 as far as downtown properties go (Golden Nugget is #1, but much more expensive). If your looking for a hip crowd and expensive duds, go to the GN. But if your like us, average working class people, the EC is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok but we are not returning”
Reviews.Author: ariesgal
Reviews.Content: We got a room in the tower. The room was clean (enough) and very roomy with a sitting room. However, I didn't like the bathroom - kinda old and the tub was sloping. The sink is outside of the bathroom and is also slanty with little counter space and it's too low. The worst thing is ventilation in the hotel - you just can't stay away from the smoke, even in a non-smoking room. Air in the casino is quite bad, even in the restaurants. They do have a section of coin-operated slot machines which I think are for the old-timers who preferred the substance and sounds of coins. Tried both restaurants in the hotel and both were alright with decent prices. Our friend got his room from Expedia at $42/night, 3-night stay special. His room is situated on top of the parking structure on the 5th floor (I think they convert it), kinda weird but has newer furnishings and decor than our room. It's suitable for those who look for good prices. Finally, I must mentioned that El Cortez has 2 parking structures, one attached, one detached. They also have a separate building (El Cortez Cabana Suites) across the street. Excellent location for those who want the Fremont Street Experience. Everthing was ok with our stay, but we usually look for more comfort and excitement so we probably won't return.

Reviews.Title: “El Cortez”
Reviews.Author: surfinsooner1967
Reviews.Content: Totally awesome host and the staff was totally excellent... Nice rooms and good slot play...New ventilation has nearly totally moved the old smokey casino problem... This is Old Vegas at its best!!!

Reviews.Title: “will not go back again!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nkh3529
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online. the pics look good online, but not the same when i arrived, i can smelled the ciggarate all the time when i was sleeping, and i can hear the other door slam in my room. the room was very small. i will not go back again. i will rather pay more money to stay in a better hotel. not recomment.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: cgplayer4
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Vegas and have always stayed on the Strip, this was my first time staying in the Freemont area. I thought I would try it for the nostalgia aspect. This is one of the true old Vegas hotels with lots of history. The hotel itself was clean, beds were good and AC worked. Security was in the parking lots to protect your cars. If you are in Vegas to gamble or sight see the El is a great place to stay. This is not one of the new hotels on the Strip so do not expect the same amenities. If that is the experience you are seeking then spend the additional funds and stay on the Strip. The staff at the El are friendly, helpful and quick to react to requests. The Freemont nightlife is well worth seeing and experiencing. For an inexpensive place to stay in Vegas I would highly recommend the El Cortez..

Reviews.Title: “If you like mechanical surprises, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: LesVargas
Reviews.Content: Yes the price is reasonable. The remodelling is OK. However if you are unlucky and the front desk staff put you in a room with mechanical problems, it can be very unnerving not to mention spooky, wierd or disgusting. This a very, very old building. Obvious and unseen maintenance concerns are ignored. If you like to gamble on your hotel also, STAY HERE AT THE EL CORTEZ.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked the El Co!”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy629
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the El Cortez on a comp I received in the mail. We had a Queen Double in the Tower - Room 614 at the end of a hall. The room was huge! It was nicely appointed and very clean. The bathroom is very small, so if you need a big bathroom, don't stay here. It was quite adequate for the 3 of us tho. We ate a Cafe Cortez for breakfast twice and dinner once. We thought the food was very good, with a very good selection. Service was a bit slow at times, but everyone that worked there was very helpful and friendly. The casino is quite big and spread out. They have the usual table games, with Black Jack at $5 a hand. They have loads of new penny machines and video poker machines in all denominations. Their dollar and quarter slots are very, very old and there is almost NO selection in the quarter range. They really need to get these updated! Many of the older machines were very, very dirty. Maybe there are plans to get new machines and this might be why there is no upkeep on them, I'm not sure? I basically just played video poker, but really would have liked to play some quarter slots. All in all, we had an excellent time! I certainly would stay there again and look forward to doing so on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kctus3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the El Cortez in the Cabana Suites. The Cabana Suites are actually across the street from the casino but it's literally 40 steps to get from one to the other. Both have security posted outside at all times so I always felt safe even if I was coming or going without my hubby with me. We got a suite on the ground floor, and called to see if we could have a suite on an upper level...( I dont like being on the ground level). They gave us a free upgrade to a bigger room on the 5th floor and the rooms are newly remodeled, quiet and VERY comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful and the casino is nice and everything is clean and comfortable. We ate breakfast at the cafe and it was decent food...not great, but not bad either. We stayed three nights, which we booked on hotels.com for $117.00! What a deal...we also got a free coupon from the hotel when we arrived for a free 2 night stay before December 28. Needless to say, we already booked our trip back. We will be bringing out two teens this time and requested rooms in the tower rooms section, which several people we gambled with and met said were really nice too, and they have two queens. The Cabana suites only have king beds. This is well worth the money and great value! It's also just a block from the Freemont street experience and all the downtown casinos and entertainment. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to go to Vegas on a budget and really get a nice place to stay!!! Thanks El Cortez....we'll see you in December!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will return!”
Reviews.Author: tamrasto
Reviews.Content: Made the decision to stay here based on user pics and reviews from Trip Advisor, and we were happy we went. So, yeah... it's not the Palms, but we felt very welcomed by the staff, and you gotta stay 'classic Vegas' at least once in your life. Very friendly security staff, front desk, you name it. Also, we had a very honest housekeeper. My husband had lost his ring, and we didn't notice until we had left the hotel for the day. When we returned that evening, the ring (that she found in the pile of towels on the floor) was placed on the counter for us to find. The tiny window in the shower that leads to the outside is just like the ones at the Gold Coast. Very strange, yet amusing at the same time! Classic. The cafe had great food at a great price and we ended up eating there twice while we were there for three days. Also enjoyed the fact that the walk from the garage to our room was much closer than the hike you gotta take when you're staying on the strip. Overall, I would return to this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: stephen42mo
